text: It's raining like hell. Flashes of lightning reveal momen glimpses of a decayed urban/industrial landscape. Far bel us, a mysterious glistening wet rock lies engulfed in the drowning earth. We descend toward the rock. Sporadic flas of lightning distort our perspective of the stone. It loo strangely beautiful, like a diamond stuck in the dark mud Closer... Closer... Suddenly, STRONG MALE HANDS cut across the frame and wren it free from its muddy grave. Even closer... And we disco that the underbelly of this beautiful rock is teeming wit every kind of slithering repulsive insect... FLASH!!*  Lightning obliterates the frame. (* FLASHES OF LIGHT from lightning, car headlights,  photographic strobe units and flashlights are used throug the following sequences as recurring transitional devices

We can barely see the darkened street in a run down part an inner city -- what we can see looks half demolished.  Flash!! Through chain link fencing, the blinding headlights of a  70'S CHEVY arc into frame. For an instant we see the flee image of a PRETTY TEENAGE GIRL. On her feet a pair of bri red high heeled shoes. The Chevy pulls up next to her.

FLASH!! An oncoming car's headlights streak across the be up Chevy's windshield... revealing... THE DRIVER, 45ish, he leans across the passenger seat and opens the car door The pretty teenage girl slides into the car. Dressed only a skirt and T-Shirt, she's soaked to the skin. Make-up ru down her face and her hair sticks to her bare shoulders. seems nervous... scared even.
Thanks.

As she closes the car door the man notices that her hand been injured. It's bound with coarse white toweling and  stained with blood. In her other hand, she clings tightly a cheap yellow leather purse. He reaches forward and puts his hand on the gear-shift, the back of his hand brushing against her leg, she moves away. He slides the gear-shift into drive. Another car's headlights flare the windshield as he pulls out into the night.

Suddenly... a powerful photographic strobe light ignites! Revealing a decrepit warehouse interior. Silhouetted brie against the paint chipped walls are two figures: A man, B KESSLER, 25, short chopped hair dressed in black on black and a woman, CARRIE LAUGHLIN, 25, short black hair and ti black clothes. Carrie holds a 35mm still camera, an umbil cord runs to a strobe light. Brian holds a flashlight in hand, a tape recorder in the other. He begins speaking in the tape recorder.
Her father worked the night shift  here. Most nights he'd bring her  with him. (pause) She was eleven years old.
His flashlight scans the ominous environment. Carrie take flash photo.

Emerging from the blackness... The same strong male hands that unearthed the rock now pulls his rain soaked jacket  clear of his torso. A crude bandage wrapped around one of the fingers. The rock is slipped up under his jacket... u against his bare chest. The jacket is pulled down to conc the rock and the faceless figure drifts away.
The beam of Brian's flashlight sweeps through the darknes revealing another room.
This is it. This is the where he'd  take her whenever he had the urge to  molest her.
The flashlight finds the corner in question. Flash!! The  warehouse lights up again, revealing a huge machine room.
Of course! Nobody would have heard  her cries over the noise of the  machines.
A male hand wipes the steamy condensation clear of his ca front window. The windshield wipers swipe incessantly at constant sheet of rain beyond.
Damn! This defroster never works...
The driver fidgets blindly with the various levers and kn He finally manages to get the defroster and heater to wor The girl leans forward into the stream of warm air.
...Mmm... feels good.
She closes her eyes, lets it blow across her face. He wat her. His eyes linger on her body.
Have a problem with your car?
She pulls her wet hair off her bruised face and gives him nervous smile.
No. (beat) My problem's with men.
He throws a curious look at her, then back to the highway
Brian's flashlight moves around the room.
This is where she murdered her first  victim. They found his body over in  the corner, shot through the head.
The flashlight continues to search through the darkness.
They found her second victim over  there.
Another flash!!!!!
Very close on the girl's yellow purse... as the metal zip is pulled open. The driver notices her opening the purse.
Okay if I smoke?
(unconvincingly) ...sure.
The driver watches as she reaches into the purse... out a soggy pack of matches. She looks at them... I look to the driver.
My matches are all wet. You got a  lighter?
(scans the dashboard) Yeah. It's here somewhere. It's my  wife's car. Ah... there it is.

He pushes the cigarette lighter in to heat. Out of the co of his eye, he sees the girl's hand slip back in her purs And stay there. She stares at the car lighter and... wait The driver glances at her, then back to the lighter.
FLASH!! As another strobe light ignites. Tape recorder ha Brian continues...
She lured them here with the promise  of sex. (beat) Imagine the anger and hatred she  must have felt returning to this  place. Did she use that to help her  pull the trigger?
Carrie snaps another shot. Flash!! The blinding flash  illuminates the night rain streaming in through the fract remains of the ceiling.
Shhhhhhhhh.
Brian stops talking. Carrie scans the darkness. From the  quiet... A Thunderous Roar!!

A Blinding Flash!! As... a semi-trailer crosses paths with the 70'S CHEVY. Close on the girl. An intent expression on her face as sh watches and waits... for the cigarette lighter to eject. hand reaches deeper into her purse. The Driver tenses as sees this. Suddenly... POP!! The lighter ejects. The Driver reaches for the dash. The girl hurriedly lifts something out from inside the bag. The Driver yanks the  lighter out... and whips a look to the girl.

Brian's flashlight sweeps across the shadowed remains of rafters and catwalks. Scanning... Listening... Brian and  Carrie glance tentatively at each other... Then slowly Ca lifts the portable strobe unit upward until it is pointin into the rafters. Carrie fires a shot, triggering a brill Flash!!
Flash! Out of the inky black... The glistening wet rock  emerges, hurtling downwards... Tumbling end over end thro the night rain...
The girl pulls a pack of cigarettes out of her purse. She looks curiously to the driver whose hand is trembling  slightly.
What's the matter?
(unconvincingly) ...nothing.

The girl reaches out, steadies his trembling hand... and  pulls the red hot coil to the cigarette between her lips. When... in a THUNDEROUS CRASH!! The glistening wet rock c smashing through their windshield!!!!
The CHEVY brakes... Skids across the rain-slicked pavemen and turns a somersault, landing upside down on its hood.
The CAMERA DRIFTS ACROSS the fractured front end of the  overturned CHEVY. The twisted hunk of metal hisses...  steams... groans. The front tire spins lazily to a halt o its mangled axle.
We see a man standing on a highway overpass. He's leaning the railing and calmly looking down at the wrecked car.
EARLY GRAYCE, 25, athletic build, big watery eyes, jet bl hair, stands by the railing. Rain streaks down his  expressionless face. He dropped the rock.
Lying in the deserted highway. The Driver crawls out cove with blood. Still clutched in his hand is the car cigaret lighter. Its red hot coil extinguishing quickly to a fain glow.

Calmly looking down with no pity. Even closer... Water ru down his face. Closer yet... On his eye... And right into the dilated pupil. As we enter it -- it's like being in a dark winding tunne filled with the hum of dynamos and the loud rhythmic pump of powerful machinery.
The distant echo of a Woman's voice.
Are you dead or alive?
Still hearing the whine from some tremendous dynamo, we e from the inside of BRIAN'S RIGHT EARDRUM, pulling back fa enough to see his face.
Brian?
Brian is distracted, distant, not paying attention to the game of "Twenty Questions" that he is playing.
Dead.
(sarcastic) Obviously!

A small party in progress. Graduate student types, smokin drinking. The usual. Carrie and Brian stand out in this g their look is more stylized, their attitude less complace Carrie, in particular, looks restless.
Man or woman?
Man.
Carrie tunes in and pays attention to the game.
Real or fictional.
Real.
Ted Bundy.
Brian's eyes dart to Carrie. The look on his face tells  everyone she nailed it. Brian gets up to get another drin Several people laugh, amazed that Carrie knows Brian so w
What a guess!
Doesn't count, she's disqualified.
Why?
Because you've been living with him,  and his thesis for the last year and  a half. (beat) He's probably been researching Ted  Bundy all week.
Carl, you are the world's worst loser!
Carl looks over to Carrie. She gives him the finger and a cheeky smile. CAROL, sitting next to Carrie, asks...
Any word from that gallery?
Not yet.
Nervous?
...Apprehensive. Let's not forget  these are the people who banned the  Mapplethorpe show. Anyway,  California's loaded with galleries.
(nods toward Brian) You mean 'Ted Bundy's' finally agreed  to leave?
Carrie watches Brian disappear into another room.
...Soon as he finishes his thesis.
Listen, Eric's been "finishing" his  for over three years now.
Carrie lights a cigarette. Her frustration is showing.
Yeah, well Brian's got 'til the end  of the summer, then I'm outta here.
She gets up and begins weaving her way through the crowde room. Carol follows.
I'm sorry, but I just can't see you  veggin' out in LA-LA LAND.

Oh, I don't know... I think that  once I dye my hair blonde, buy a  string bikini and cultivate that  tan... I could be veggin' out with  the best of 'em... (does a valley- girl/beach bunny) Like fer shurr!
Carrie and Carol share a strained laugh.
Sequence omitted from original script.

The room's crowded with people. There's a lot of noise -- "shop talk," banter. Clipped conversations overlap, as we find Brian with his friend Eric. They are in the midst of making a blender of margaritas.
I'm talking about the mind and  culpability of a serial killer.  Someone who has no ability to  distinguish between right and wrong  should not be imprisoned, let alone  executed.
Eric dumps in a handful of ice cubes as Brian pours in th booze.
Oh, here we go again. Let's just lay  it all at the altar of misfiring  synapses, amok biochemicals and  horrendous childhoods.
Look, it's a fact, most of these  people suffer from a severe chemical  brain imbalance. (beat) That enough Tequila?
Probably not...
Brian pours in the rest of the bottle.
(to Eric) The answer is research and treatment  under hospital supervised conditions,  not the electric chair!
Eric looks for triple sec in the cupboards. PETER overhea them on his way to the refrigerator.
Yeah, until it's your mother's head  they find in the refrigerator.
He pulls open the refrigerator door and grabs two beers.  Carrie steps up behind Brian.
Executing the killer wouldn't bring  my mother back.
Thank god!
Brian turns to see Carrie now behind him. She wraps her a around his neck.
(sarcastic to Carrie) Ha, ha.
Yeah, but it'd sure make you feel  better, wouldn't it?
No, it wouldn't make me feel better.
Peter finds triple sec in the refrigerator.
...Looking for this?
Eric takes the triple sec from Peter and pours some in th blender. He turns it on. It whines.
(to Brian) If I have to listen to one more  "tweed" talk about his dissertation,  I'm going to throw up.
(to Brian) Label it anyway you want, the bottom  line is these people are evil, plain  and simple.
(continuing with Eric) Okay, now you want to talk about  good versus evil? Well then let's  start with Adam and Eve and the snake.
Who do I have to blow to get out of  here?
(reconsiders) A... I gotta go.
A relic from the fifties with large glass windows. The ra has stopped but the streets are still wet. Early's piece shit Grand Prix pulls into the lot. He gets out and walks into the diner.
The place is almost empty. Early, still wet from the rain walks to the counter and sits down. He calls out to the  kitchen.
Coffee and a bowl of chili, please.
...Be right there.
The only other customer is an OLD MAN, sitting at the cou nearby nursing a cup of coffee. His face half hidden unde rain soaked hat. Early selects a tune from the countertop juke box.
Out of the corner of his eye he sees a bug (from the conc block) crawl out of Early's sleeve and onto the counter.
(from beneath his  shadowy brim...) The Antichrist'll be a woman, in a  man's body. Seven heads and seven  tails.
Early gazes at the Old Man curiously, then calls out to t waitress...
Make that to go.

Early notices the small bug crawling across the counter. leans closer to it and watches it. After a moment, he THW it off the counter with his thumb and finger. The bug lan on the hot iron griddle with a SIZZLE! EARLY glances at the Old Man again... then scoots over on stool closer to him. Early seems curious to want to get a glimpse under the brim of the Old Man's hat.
The waitress is bagging Early's order to go... when the f door slams shut!

The waitress re-enters the room. It's empty. Neither the Man nor Early are there. With Early's food in hand, she m her way along the rear of the counter toward the front do She glances around curiously. On the griddle, the remains something black and charred smoulders. Closer to the entr she stares at the front door. The sign that hangs in its  window has been turned... the backside which faces her re

She wonders about the sign for a moment, then stares curi out the window... not a soul in sight. She locks the door and begins closing up for the night. She turns to make he way to the rear of the diner then notices something. Slow she moves along the side wall, past a number of highbacke booths.

Sitting on one of the funky old leather seats in a booth a pair of RED HIGH HEELED SHOES (the same pair worn earli by the Pretty Teenage Girl). The Waitress glances nervous about the interior. No one in sight.
She reaches down slowly and picks up the pair of shoes. L at them closely. Stares at the inside lining. Then sudden out of the quiet... a voice.
...Size 6.
The Waitress spins a startled look to the booth beyond he Early leans out from behind the highback partition.
That's right ain't it, size 6?
The Waitress... smiles, nods shyly.
Happy birthday Adele.
Early, you are so sweet.
This is ADELE CORNERS. She's 17, pretty, uneducated and  Early's girlfriend. She steps over to him, gives him a ki then sits down on the seat across from him. She starts to try on her new shoes.
I feel kind of like the wizard of  oz, you know when she gets the red  shoes.
Well Dorothy, why don't you hand me  that chili there.
She passes the bag to Early. He digs in. Between bites, h glances over to Adele who's enthusiastically pulling on t new shoes.

A door swings open spilling light into a darkened room. B and Carrie, a little drunk, return home from the party. Their apartment is in an old converted industrial buildin in a funky low rent part of town. Brian walks ahead, Carrie trails behind him, peeling off clothes. She begins unzipping her dress, unnoticed by Bri
Tonight turned out to be pretty  interesting.
The party?
She grabs a leather cap that sits on a chair.
The warehouse. I'm not that drunk.
It was definitely the high point of  the evening.
Carrie's dress falls to the floor.
(getting excited) Just being there where it really  happened. It was different... more  visceral.
Mmm... I love it when you talk like  that.

Brian is at the foot of the bed, he turns to see... Carri has transformed. She has stripped down to her black bra a panties, fishnet stockings, a nightporter style leather c A surprised Brian stands there a moment. Looking at Carri She looks great.
Carrie pushes Brian back onto the bed.
Carrie climbs on top of him. She kisses his neck. Slowly  starts working her lips across his chest and down his sto
A solitary trailer sits alongside a run down house.

Through the soot tinged atmosphere, sunlight filters in p the curtained windows. Early is lying face down in bed, h right arm extended over the side. Adele is in the kitchen half dressed, and unsuccessfully attempting to iron one o Early's shirts. She realizes the iron is out of water, sh sets it down and steps to the sink and fills a glass with water. As she does she glances at a cactus on the counter
You thirsty Lucy?
She waters her small cactus (Lucy).
Bet that feels good, don't it?
Adele smiles then notices that a photo held to the fridge a decorative magnet has fallen to the floor. She picks it up.
Now if that ain't Momma's little  angel.

Adele puts it back onto the fridge. It is a photo of a yo Early with his mother. In the photo Early appears to be a ten or eleven. he stands next to his mother. Her arm is d over his shoulders, she is holding a drink. A cigarette b dangles between her fingers. Nearby a portable radio is t to music, when the local radio jingle comes on and segues the news.
A handkerchief bandana is tied around his head and over h eyes. The NEWSCASTER'S voice gets louder.
...two more victims last night, when  a twenty pound rock smashed through  the windshield of their car...

Slowly he reaches to his face and lifts the bandana up of one eye. Even closer on his left eyelid. It flutters... p open and blinks. Now... his eyeball stares right at us. T pitch black pupil contracts in the morning light. The  newscaster's voice continues to amplify...
This was the third such attack in  the past month and while an extensive  police operation is underway... no  arrests have yet been made.
The newscaster's voice quickly fades away. Early calmly c his eyes and drifts back to sleep.

Early emerges from the trailer drinking a bottle of beer. looks around the yard, it's full of various kinds of usel junk. He walks over to his car. Adele appears in the door of the trailer in her bathrobe.
Early...
She glances around to make certain that no one's looking, then 'flashes' her body to Early with a giggle.
Have a good one.
Early smiles. Adele turns back into the trailer then,  remembers...
Oh... I forgot to tell you, Mr.  Diebold was by again yesterday.
Early looks at the run down house next door where Diebold lives. A beat up red pick-up is parked in front.
He said, if he ain't got the rest of  his money by the end of the month,  he's gonna "kick us the... (spells the word fuck  to avoid saying it) F-U-C-K outta here."
Early works his jaw, thinking.
He said that, huh? Cursed in front  of you?
Adele nods.
You gonna talk to him?
Early gets in his car.
If he comes back, don't answer the  door.
Early revs the raspy engine.
Suppose he hears me inside?
Adele's words are unheard as Early pulls away flinging hi beer bottle at a couple of chained PITBULLS in Diebold's  front yard.
Sequence omitted from original script.
Brian enters the darkened loft interior.
I picked up some Chinese. Did you  hear from the gallery?

Brian turns the corner, he's immediately greeted by a ser of erotic images being projected on the far wall. They ar slides of Carrie's photographic work. In regard to the na and content of Carrie's photographic work, her photograph address the sexual collision of opposites. "What if's." T subjects of her photographs are hypothetical and highly  unlikely partners. Studies in contract. Moments of passio
(tentative) You got your slides back.
From across the room, he hears Carrie's disembodied voice He drifts toward the couch.
Yeah, same old shit. Too graphic...  not suitable for mass consumption...  one of those... I forget. Who cares.

Brian finds her slumped down on the couch. He sits down.  She's got a drink in her hand. A bottle on her lap. She  continues to click through the slides. As she rambles on, it's obvious that she's definitely under the influence of something 90 proof.

Christ Brian I'm dying here... you  are too, you just don't know it yet.  You're too busy working on that damned  thesis... And, thing is... when you  finally do finish it, it's just gonna  get filed away on some shelf at the  University Library... then what?
Brian can see she's upset. Drowsy from the booze. He just watches her. Listens. Her words linger in his head.
(continues) I thought you wanted to be a writer.
(quietly) ...I do.
Then you can write anywhere. Let's  get out of here, while we still can.
Carrie, come on... we can leave  anytime we...

No we can't. We can never leave once  you start talking about tenure...  and vacation pay... and parking  privileges and... oh shit! let's  just go to California now, right  now, before it's too late.
...just like that?
Just like that. Load up the Lincoln...  point it West... stop when we hit  the fucking ocean.
The bold graphic sexual photographs of Carrie's continue accentuate her comments.
That's half the kick anyway. Doing  something you've never done before.  Experiencing something... different.  Something... unpredictable.

Brian notices an envelope on the floor nearby. He picks i up. Opens it. Inside, he finds the photographs Carrie too at the warehouse. Interested, he shuffles through them. H becomes more and more intrigued with what he sees.
...These are great.
He glances over to Carrie... she's fallen asleep. He reac over and quietly pulls the drink glass from her hand.
Early's Grand Prix has a head of steam up as it tears acr the drive and hangs a hard right into his parking space n to the trailer. Suddenly, Early hits the brakes hard! Ano car is parked there.
Early spills through the doorway.
Adele, who's car's that out...
Early spots his PAROLE OFFICER standing in the bedroom ar snooping around. He has a prosthetic hand which he uses t search through Early's things.
She's not here.
The Parole Officer hiccups throughout the scene.
What are you doin' here? I ain't  supposed to be at the Parole Office  'til tomorrow, two o'clock.
Early notices the man looking through some of his letters and papers.
Social call.
The Parole Officer opens one of the closet doors, pilfers through things inside, as if searching for something. Ear is getting pissed off but says nothing.
You're supposed to call me when you  lose your job Early. I stopped by  the mirror factory today, you left  quite a mess behind there.
Wasn't my fault...
He lifts his crudely bandaged middle finger.
...It was dangerous there and they  treated me like shit.
Parole Officer steps over to the refrigerator, opens it,  snoops around inside.

(swallows a hiccup) Yeah... Well you never have been  'treated right'... Have you? (hiccup) Your father was pickin' on you when  he threw you out of the house for  stealing the tires off his truck.  The Marines misunderstood you when  they gave you that dishonorable  discharge.
He finishes with the refrigerator and continues his searc through the drawers and cabinets of the trailer.
(hiccup) ...The police were way out of line  when they stopped you from beating  that bartender half to death. And no  doubt God'll be pickin' on you on  Judgement Day...
I ain't got nothing against God.  It's the people he let come into the  world... lot of them should have  been stopped at the door. What are  you looking for?
The Parole Officer ignores the question. He steps up to a sink overflowing with dirty dishes.
That girlfriend of yours ain't much  for housekeeping, is she.
Early dismisses the place with a glance.
I'm thinking about moving...
Early opens the refrigerator, grabs a bottle of beer.
Maybe down to Texas... Probably get  some work on them offshore oil rigs.  Hear the pay's good... hell, the  weather's got to be better'n here.
Early sits down at the table. The Parole Officer steps ov to him.
What are you talking about? You know  you can't leave the state. (hiccup) What you can do is get a job.
The Parole Officer pulls a slip of paper from his shirt  pocket, sets it on the table.
You be at this personnel office,  Friday, three o'clock sharp.
What is it?
...Janitor's job.
Oh man... come on, I don't want no  janitor job.
Early lifts his beer for another drink. The Parole Office prosthetic hand snaps tight around the neck of the beer  bottle, just inches from Early's lips.
Hey, I don't give two shits about  what you want or don't want... I'm  telling you to be there Friday, three  o'clock sharp or the sheriff will be  here for dinner. You understand?
With that Early looks up at the man, almost defiantly, th stands up. The Parole Officer hiccups again. Early stares him for a moment.
You oughta think about putting a bag  over your head... Might cure them  hiccups.
The Parole Officer shakes his head in disgust and walks o of the trailer to his car.
Sequence omitted from original script.

head_text.subj: BRIAN'S DESK IN ANOTHER PART OF LOFT APARTMENT

text: Brian's in the midst of working his way through pages and pages of thesis notes scattered atop his desk. Using  chopsticks he shovels Chinese straight out of the carton he studies Carrie's warehouse photographs.
As we approach Brian from behind, moving closer, closer.
Carrie steps up behind him. She's rubbing her eyes, havin just awakened. A hangover beckons. Brian notices her.
Hey. I didn't have the heart to wake  you.
Thanks. What are you doing?
Well, I sat down with my tapes and  your photographs, which are great by  the way... and I started writing.
Carrie grabs his container of Chinese and takes a few bit Listens.
So how's it going?
...I think it's the best stuff I've  done.
Carrie glances over his shoulder at his writing.
...and I think I know why.
Why?
Because I was there. And for a moment  that night I understood how she came  to pull the trigger.
(sarcastic) This mean your finally going to finish  your thesis?
Look, fuck the thesis. I think there's  a book here. Your photographs and my  research, together.
A book on the warehouse murders?
A book on some of the most infamous  murderers in America. I want to go  to where they lived and where they  killed and I want you to photograph  it.
Brian reaches down to the floor and pulls a large map of United States up and lays it out on his desk. He traces a route West. Along the way, specific locations have been  circled.

What I'm thinking is, we can drop  down through Tennessee, across  Arkansas and into Texas, from there  it's a straight shot into California. (pause) "We don't stop... until we hit the  fucking ocean."
It's about fucking time, Kessler!  I'd just about given up on you.
We don't have enough money, but we'll  figure something out.
Carrie steps up to Brian.
...It's either the best idea I've  had in a long time... or there's way  too much MSG in this stuff.
Brian looks at the container of Chinese in his hand. Carr takes it from him, sets it down on the road map. Kisses h
Early exits the trailer and climbs into his Grand Prix.

Early tries to get the engine to tick over. Then... He se JOHN DIEBOLD, his landlord, emerge from his house and beg lumbering toward the Grand Prix. The two panting ugly-ass pitbulls trot alongside their master.
(shouts) Hold on a minute there boy!
Shit!
Early tries the engine again. Still won't start. Diebold, getting closer. The dogs are barking.
Goddamit, you're gonna settle up  that rent here and now.

Hurriedly, Early tries the engine one more time. It start Grinning from ear to ear, Early pulls away before Diebold and his dogs reach him. Pissed, Diebold grabs a rock and hurls it, hitting Early' car. The car stops, dead in its tracks.
I've had it with your bullshit boy.  I want my money.
Early looks in the rear-view mirror and sees... Diebold  standing there confrontational. Early throws the gearshift into reverse...

Tires screeching, the car surges toward Diebold and the d Scared shitless... Diebold begins back peddling. Confused the pitbulls bark, then follow suit. Early laughs as he stalks Diebold. Diebold jumps out of the way of the Grand Prix just as it pulverizes his portable barbecue. Early shifts it into drive and barrels out of the drive.
As soon as the Grand Prix is out of sight...
(hollering) You sonofabitch! Come back here!
Furious, he turns to find Adele staring at him from the w of her trailer.
That's it! You tell him... I want  you both the fuck out of here by  Sunday or I'm gonna call the Police.
Adele starts laughing, she tries to hide it with her hand
...You won't be laughing come Sunday  little girl.
Muttering to himself, he turns back toward his house. He  then notices what Adele is laughing at. One pitbull is tr to hump the other.
Elvis! Get the fuck off him!
Peering out at him from the trailer window laughing at th dogs.
Brian pulls up in his BLACK '62 LINCOLN CONTINENTAL. The  suicide doors and leather interior have seen better days. Brian locks his car and walks into the building.
Brian steps up to a large bulletin board. He sees several 'Ride-Share' notes to various cities on the board. He pin Ride-Share note onto the board. We see the note is headli in red - "CALIFORNIA"
You know, they say one of these  days...
Brian glances over his shoulder.
(sarcastic) ...the whole thing's going to slide  into the ocean... Yeah, I know.
Carol peers over Brian's shoulder and reads the note.

"Looking for someone to take turns  at the wheel and share expenses...  on a week long cross country blue- highways tour of historic murder  sites..." (beat) You gotta be kidding. Who in their  right mind would want to do that?
...I would.
Brian smiles at her and walks away.
(watching Brian walk  away) Like I said...
She shakes her head.
Where's the personnel office at?
Carol turns to see Early.
(points down the hall) First door on the left.
She walks away. Early's eye catches the bulletin board, h sees in bold red marker - "CALIFORNIA."
Adele steps out of the trailer.
Early?
She walks carefully around the junk piles. It's dark; har to see. She comes to the edge of a deep dark hole and pee in... She can't see anything but hears the rustling of a  shovel digging.
Early? You down there?
The sound of digging stops.
(from inside the hole) What's up Adele? Dinner ready?
Almost.
After a moment's hesitation, Early resumes his digging.
Early...
The digging stops again.
Tell me more about California.
The moonlight illuminates his face when he looks up at he
Well... for one thing... They think  faster out there, on account of all  that warm weather they got; cold  weather makes people stupid, that's  a fact.
I guess that'd explain why there's  so many stupid people around here.

Yeah, and in California you never  have to buy fruit 'cause it's all on  the trees everywhere you turn... (beat) ...and, 'course there ain't no speed  limit out there, and all drugs are  legal... And I heard your first  month's rent is free; state law. I  figure 'til we get settled we can  just move around month to month...
What'll we do out there?
Well... the very first thing we're  gonna do... is get us a couple of  six packs of Lucky Lager and climb  up on toppa' that famous Hollywood  sign and howl at the moon...
Early lets out a playful howl, as Adele looks up over her shoulder at the moon.
You know... I read once... Ain't  nothin' on that big old moon 'cept  some old golf balls those astronauts  left behind.
Bull. That ain't right... Government  sends people there all the time,  just don't want us to know about it.
Adele smiles and begins walking back to the trailer.
Don't be long now, dinner's 'bout  ready.
I heard that.

After a moment, Early climbs out of the hole and stands i the moonlight for a moment. We see that he's completely n except for a pair of high top steel toed work boots. Earl gazes up into the night sky, looking at the cold white mo
Brian exits loft carrying two bags. Carrie is also carryi a bag, and smoking a cigarette, as they walk to the car.
What did he sound like on the phone?
Real polite. Kept calling me 'sir.'
Brian throws the bags in the open trunk with the other ba
(grins) I like that.
I still think we should have met  them first.
Beggars can't be choosers. They were  the only ones who answered the ride  share note, remember?
Carrie bows her head and folds her hands in mock prayer.
Please God, we're gonna be stuck  with these people for a week, don't  let them be as boring as Brian's  friends. Anything... but that.
Brian throws a needling glance to Carrie and slams the ca hood shut. They both get into the car, Brian behind the w
Oh, yeah... He had a real thick accent  right outta "Deliverance." (quotes from the movie) "Still? Who said anything about a  still? Get ya ass up in them woods!"
Funny, very funny.
Brian starts the car. It backfires loudly startling Carri Brian laughs.
(quoting again) "Aintry? This river don't go to  Aintry."
The engine revs again and the Lincoln pulls away down the street.
PAN UP from Adele's new red high-heeled shoes. We hear Ad speaking with an unfamiliar tone of authority to her voic
We shouldn't be doin' this, Early.  You leavin' the state, ridin' around  with strangers... besides, what kinda  people would want to stop at places  where other people was murdered.
The camera slowly reveals Adele... and the fact that she alone as she voices her concerns. Then from behind her Ea approaches. Just in time to hear...
What if they're dangerous?
They ain't dangerous Adele. They're  writers.
Startled, Adele drops her shoulder bag. It lands on top o couple of cardboard boxes and a beat up old duffle bag -- all their possessions. A few personal items spill out of
Early Grayce!
She kneels down to pick things up.
(changes subject) Did you settle things with Mr.  Diebold?
Yeah I left him with the car... We're  all squared up now.
As Adele picks up her spilled personal possessions, Early notices her prized cactus in the bag.
What's this?
He angrily reaches in and grabs it.
Early!
She reaches for the cactus but misses.
What kind of a person would carry a  cactus in her purse!
Adele bites her lip almost crying. Suddenly, Early looks  past Adele to see something, Adele turns too.
The Lincoln comes gliding into view.
Through the windshield we see Early... Adele by his side.
You've got to be kidding me, they  look like Okies!
Brian honks the horn, Early waves back.
Jesus... They've probably got five  bucks between them. Turn around.
Lighten up...
Geez, they look kinda weird.
You just smile, let me do all the  talking.
How many times you gonna tell me  that?
(smiling at Brian) As many times as it takes.
Brian stops the Lincoln and gets out. He approaches Early and shakes his hand, then Adele's.
Hi I'm Brian... Early, and you must  be Adele.
An awkward moment as everyone just stands there... until  Brian reaches for Adele's bag.
Let me help you.
Brian picks up her bag and carries it to the Lincoln. Ade is instantly won over by the gesture -- Early leery of it
Carrie watches as Brian and Early carry their things to t trunk. Carrie leans forward and sets the trip odometer to zero. When she sits back up, Adele is standing at her win
Hi, I'm Adele.
(reserved) Carrie.
She turns away from the window...
(shyly) I like your hair.
Carrie turns back, rolls down window...
...Pardon?
...I said, I like your hair.
...Thank you.
She turns and sees Early reflected in the side mirror wat her. He grins at her, Carrie looks away.
Brian crams the last of the bags in, as Early watches.
Tight fit.
Best kind.
Brian looks to him, Early grins and winks. Brian slams th Lincoln trunk lid shut.

From the blackness... The camera rises from a pile of rub As it ascends we reveal Diebold's pitbulls howling and di at a mound of fresh earth where Early's hole used to be. The crackling flames of a nearby fire illuminate the scen Deep in the distance, the wail of approaching sirens.
Reveal that it's Early's trailer and car that are on fire
Flames consume the magazine photos of Elvis and Priscilla Farrah and Ryan, Early and Adele. Along with them, the bl and white photo of young Early and his mother.
On the Lincoln as it exits the Bus Station. The camera  descends toward a lone trash can, to find there, lying am the debris inside... Adele's cactus.
The Lincoln passes through on its way out of town.
Brian behind the wheel, Carrie riding shotgun. Early and  Adele are sitting in the back seat. An awkward silence  prevails. Brian clears his throat.
Uh, we can stop somewhere if you and  Adele haven't had time for breakfast,  Early.
Well, it's like this, Mr. Kessler.
Brian.
Well, it's like this, Bri'. I don't  eat much in the mornin', never have.  Maybe a beer once in a while; Lucky  Lager's my favorite.
Brian raises his eyebrow a tad, but is not really curious about it.
It's because of what he read in a  book once... That folks needin'  breakfast is a myth, or whatever,  put out by those cereal people.
A glance passes between Brian and Carrie. Is she for real
Early motions Adele not to talk so much.
So what do you do Early?
Oh... I do some work up at the Merrick  Mirror factory, or I used to...

One night we figured out how much  bad luck he must have comin' from  all them mirrors he broke... (beat) Four hundred and ninety four years  to work it all off... After he dies,  he'll have to keep coming back to  earth over and over and over...
Karma.
Adele and early show no sign of understanding the word.
What?
Karma... (beat) You know, if you do something bad to  somebody fate will pay you back by  something bad happening to you.
That French ain't it?
Carrie glances at the odometer on the dash... THE FIRST M clicks over.
Everyone takes a last look at the familiar countryside. C is snapping photos of the twisting concrete overpasses an the gloomy grey sky beyond.
Adele watches Carrie, intrigued by the obvious skill Carr shows with the camera. Brian glances into the rear-view m at Adele.
So Adele, did Early happen to mention  the places we'll be stopping at?
ON ADELE'S REFLECTION IN MIRROR... then Early leans in fr of her.
Yeah Bri' I did.
Adele leans against Carrie's front seat.
(to Carrie) Are you takin' the pictures?
(surprised) ...Yeah.
Is it hard to learn?
Not really.
Early pulls Adele back toward the back seat.
(to Brian) You gonna talk to the people who did  those murders?
That's a good idea. Unfortunately  most of them have been executed.
...Too bad.
Lincoln drives off down the highway.
Police and Firemen sift through the smoking ruins of Earl trailer. The Parole Officer pulls up in his car, he gets and approaches a Police Officer.
What happened?
Who are you?
His Parole Officer.
Right, I talked to you on the phone.  They say it's a torch job, that sound  like your boy?
Could be.
Where would we find him?
Hell if I know, crazy son of a bitch  said he was thinking of moving to  Texas.
Without his car?
We see the smoldering remains of Early's Grand Prix. In t background Diebold's pitbulls are being dragged away by a Dog Wrangler.
What about the owner of the house... (reads from note pad) ...this John Diebold, any idea where  he might be?
No, but I can tell you he's not gonna  be too happy about this.
From inside Early's hole we hear a voice call out.
Jesus Christ!
Parole Officer and Police Officer turn back toward the  trailer, as people rush to the site.
The camera aerials down past those gathering around the  freshly dug hole to... a Laborer standing at the bottom o the pit. Alongside his shovel, we see that a man's arm ha been unearthed.
The Police and Parole Officer join several others standin there.
...Diebold?
...That'd be my guess.
Looks like somebody cut off his ring  finger.
Well now I'd say that's the least of  Mr. Diebold's problems.
The two men look to one another... as others begin to une the body.

Close up, Diebold's ring on a hand twisting open a bottle cap. Pull back to reveal that it is Early as he opens a b of Lucky Lager beer and takes a sip. On the back seat bet them sits a brown paper bag. Adele reaches into the bag a pulls out a cheap pocket camera. Excitedly she rips open box and pulls out the camera. She leans over and kisses E
Thank you.
Early reaches in the bag and pulls out a small plastic bo of mineral water and an orange juice.
All right, who gets the... (can't pronounce name) ...water.
Carrie turns around, Early hands her the water. Early lea forward and hands Brian the orange juice.
Here you go Bri'. Got a couple a  bags of chips and some jerky, just  holler if you want some.
Then Early reaches past Brian to the rear-view mirror and hangs a plastic St. Christopher statue around it.
Can't hurt.
How much do I owe you?
Forget it.
Adele struggles to understand the camera instructions on side of the box. She leans forward and shows Carrie her  camera.
(embarrassed) Guess I don't know the first thing  about cameras.
Carrie deliberates her response for a moment, then...
Well, the first thing... is you need  film. Preferably black and white.
Carrie pulls a roll of film out of her bag and takes Adel camera to load.
You wouldn't have any color film,  would ya?
...Yeah, sure.
She pulls a roll of color film out of her camera bag and  quickly snaps it into the camera.
I like things in color, pink, purple,  and red. I dunno, black and white is  kinda... boring.
Carrie points the camera at a smiling Adele and snaps the first picture.
You just aim and press the button.
Adele takes the camera.
Adele focuses her camera at the scenery out the side wind of the car.
Look, Pigeon Forge!
Road sign to Pigeon Forge.
Adele leans out the side rear window to get a better view
I've heard of that! It's where Dolly  Parton has her park. "Dollywood". I  just think that's so clever.  Hollywood. Dollywood. Get it?
With that, she plops back down into the back seat.
(under his breath) Shush, Adele.
Early, can we stop there... just for  a little while.
As we see the car disappearing into the distance, we can  still hear Adele rambling on.
...I've always wanted to go there...  It could be such fun.
The Lincoln approaches on a dirtroad and passes a mailbox with the name "BAXTER" on it. The Lincoln turns into the  long driveway.
Brian begins talking into a small portable tape recorder.
The Novaks are all gone but the fence  that Michael Zaruba was hired to put  up is still here.
He glances to Carrie, who fires off several photos of the fence and yard. The Lincoln continues slowly down the long drive... Up ah through the windshield Brian sees a beautiful old farm ho
The Novaks embraced the young drifter  as one of their own.
The Lincoln slows to a halt. Carrie and Brian exit the ca and begin walking toward the house. Early follows. Adele, uncertain about what's transpiring, trails behind.
Hey you two.
Brian and Carrie turn to see... Adele training a camera o them.
Give me a smile now.

Brian and Carrie look to one another then force a weak sm Early jumps in and throws a pair of devil's horns up behi Brian's unsuspecting head as... the shutter clicks. Brian and Carrie quickly turn their attention back on the house.
(continues into tape  recorder) Neighbors said he was a quiet young  man, who was often seen pushing the  children on the swing set.

An unusual bird house and a tricycle sit in the front yar To the side of the house are the remains of an old swing  set. Carrie finds an interesting angle on the swing set,  with the house in the background, SNAP! She fires off a s
(continuing) Everything was fine until the day  the family ran out of work for  Michael, and had to ask him to leave.
As Carrie frames up another shot, Early crosses in front her camera. Realizing he is in Carrie's photo he stops an poses. Carrie looks to Brian.
Sorry, Early... Could you step out  the way, for a second?
Early is surprised that they don't want him in the photog He wanders away from the front of the house. Meanwhile, A photographs the moment.
The first one to die was the nine  year old daughter...
Just then... A NINE YEAR OLD GIRL comes running from arou the side of the house. She stops dead when she sees all o them. Carrie snaps a final photo.
Hello.
The little girl scans all their faces.
...My name's Brian, what's yours?
The little girl remains silent. Brian rolls a look to Car then back to the little girl.
...Could I speak to your parents?
After an awkward pause, the little girl silently crosses yard to the porch and opens the front door.
(rudely) Pa! There's more of them.

Looking into the house through a kitchen window we can se into the entrance hall and through to the open front door Brian waits outside on the porch, as the little girl ente the house looking for her father. Inside the kitchen, rig next to the window, is a side table with a telephone and purse on it. Suddenly... Early's reflection appears in the window; he obviously seen the purse.
Brian motions for Carrie to join him.
Adele watches Brian and Carrie for a moment, then loses  interest. She stands on the seat of the swing and begins  swinging.

head_text.subj: AT THE REAR OF THE HOUSE

text: Early tries to push up the kitchen window. It barely lift three inches before jamming. Through the room we see the  little girl and her father step to the front door.
A MIDDLE AGED FARMER with tanned leathery skin. He is not happy. Brian extends his hand...
(friendly) Hi, my name is Brian Kessler.
The father says nothing and does not respond to the exten hand. Brian retracts his hand.
(continues -- less  confident) I'm a writer, I'm working on a book  about famous murderers.
Adele swings higher. Her summer dress ripples in the wind smile on her face.

Early's entire arm is through the opening. His shoulder  presses against the window pane. But still he can't reach the purse. So, he grabs the tablecloth and begins pulling toward him. The purse slides closer, inch by inch. All th while, he keeps one eye on the Farmer across the room. EARLY'S POV (ACROSS THE ROOM) The Farmer's back is turned the kitchen as he listens silently to Brian.
...I'm sure you're aware that this  is the Novak house...
Adele swings even higher. She's lost in the moment. Eupho
(corrects himself) ...I mean, this was the Novak house... (pause) With your permission I'd like to  come in and photograph...
Before Brian can finish, the man slams the door in his fa
The Farmer turns away from the front door.
(muttering) Goddamned ghouls...
We see that Early and the purse have gone.
Brian is surprised. He just stands there a moment. He's n sure whether to knock again.
The empty swing sways back and forth.
Brian and Carrie walk back to the car.
(upset) We could have been in and out of  there in less than ten minutes...
Hey, I got some great stuff... it's  okay.
Brian continues on in a huff until Carrie breaks stride a stops. She pulls him next to her.
It's okay... okay?
Brian glances back at the house. She interrupts his glanc kisses him.
(continuing on the  heel of the kiss) ...That house is part of American  history now, whether he likes it or  not.
They enter the car.
Forget about it Bri'. I wouldn't be  surprised if that Karma thing don't  come back and get him.
Carrie, surprised at Early's new found philosophical beli She looks into her side view mirror... And sees Early smi back at her. Carrie looks away...
Shifts from the mirror to the house in the background... the car pulls out of the driveway, the little girl watche from her porch.
Sequence omitted from original script. EXT. - LINCOLN PULLS UP TO MOTEL AND PARKS.
A small roadside diner. A fair number of people inside ha dinner. Adele, Early, Carrie, and Brian are seated at one the tables.

Carrie watches Early eat with a kind of horrible, rude  fascination. He has no table manners at all. He eats with his elbows on the table, fork wedged in the fist of his r hand. All the while, he chews with his mouth open. He's  serious about his "eating."
(studying his map) Well we've come three hundred miles  so far. Not a bad day's haul.
Early doesn't bother to respond. He keeps eating.
You got any family or friends in  California, Early?
With a piece of bread he mops up the gravy on his plate.
(chewing) Nope... You?
Early's foot itches... He tries to scratch it but it does do any good.
No.
Me neither. How 'bout you Carrie?
No.

As Brian folds up the map. Early takes off his boot, then his well-worn sock. Carrie's look of disgust grows as Ear brings his foot up onto his lap and scratches it while he eats. Carrie puts her fork down: dinner is over for her.
...Well, least we got each other.  That's somethin'.

Brian looks up, sees Carrie's expression... Then what's  causing it... Early mops up the last bit of food on his p He notices Brian and Carrie staring at him and slowly put his foot back down on the floor -- then the sock. Brian picks up the check to see the total... Starts pulli his wallet out... Isn't quite sure how to bring up the ta to Early.
Thanks Bri', I'll get the next one. (prompts Adele) Think it's time we hit the sack.
Early winks at Brian, Carrie catches the wink. Early and  Adele get up and head for the door. Adele waves goodnight
(to Carrie) Sweet dreams.

Close on Carrie, she is reflected in a mirror. Reveal, Ca wearing only a T-shirt is at the vanity angrily brushing teeth. In the bathroom next to her, a bath is running. In the adjacent bedroom, Brian is in the bed working on his  notes.
(spits out a mouthful  of water) You mean because I object to having  somebody take off their shoe and  scratch their foot while I'm eating  I'm prejudiced?
(reading notes) He can't help the way he was raised.  I kinda feel sorry for him.
Carrie pauses in brushing her teeth.
Feel sorry for him? Obviously you  didn't get a whiff of that sock?
Bitch, bitch, bitch!
(under her breath) Up yours.
I heard that.
Carrie finishes brushing her teeth. Secretively she gives Brian the finger...
...heard that too.
Carrie glances at the bath water running in the tub. It's rusty brown and disgusting. She pulls the plug on the bat idea.

location: EARLY AND ADELE'S MOTEL BATHROOM ROOM

text: The tap is running at the sink as Early empties the stole purse. He adds the last few coins to a small pile of cash
Can you believe thirty bucks for  this room... for what? A lumpy  mattress, that crummy TV and a  crapper.
Early, sing me a song.
Early continues to sift through all the items from the pu
Which one.
Adele starts to sing a song.
Early start sing with her... As the song ends.
(laughs) Hey can we go to that Chinese  restaurant when we get to Los Angeles?  You know, to see all them famous  footprints?
Early reaches down into the bottom of the purse and pulls out a pair of glistening stainless steel scissors.
Only if they let me put mine down  too.
He stares at the scissors curiously, then switches off th bathroom light.
Look Carrie, we're gonna be stuck  with these people for a week...
Click, a light is turned on. Revealing...
Brian has turned on the nightstand light. He and Carrie a lying in bed.
...And all I'm saying is I think we  ought to try and get along with them.  That's all.
You try, I'm gonna pretend they're  with somebody else.
Carrie.
I don't want to talk about it.
Brian turns the light off. From the blackness...
Pretty smooth how he stiffed us on  dinner?
Brian switches the light back on.
He didn't stiff us. He paid for the  gas remember.
Silence... Brian reaches out for the light... when
I'm telling you he's nearly broke  and we're going to end up paying for  those two.
Brian decides to leave the light on. He moves closer to  Carrie. He slides up against her backside. He reaches for her under the sheets. Kisses her neck.
You finished?
Carrie pushes her body up against his in response.
...Um, maybe... maybe not.
Brian's mouth moves down along her back. He slips beneath the sheets. From the expression on her face, she obviousl approves... Yet she can't resist slipping in another rema
...Um... Funky fucking sock.
Carrie rolls over on her back. Brian moves on top of her. Kisses her stomach.
...and what's with that hair? Is  that grease or motor oil or what?
Carrie reaches down and grabs two fists full of Brian's h She pulls him to her. He slides up along her chest, kissi her. Things heat up. She reaches out, grasps his arms. Pu him closer.
...you believe that tattoo? Looks  like he had another girls name there  and carved it out.

Brian bites at her neck. She stops talking. His sweating  shoulder presses against her face. She turns her head to  encourage him. In the dresser mirror... she sees their shadowy reflectio Their bodies atangle under the sheets.
...and that body odor.

Their reflection in the mirror intrigues her. Intoxicates her. His aggression excites her. She pulls him into her. metal bedframe bangs against the motel wall repeatedly as they make love. Then slowly, the camera bisects the plaster and lumber di and emerges in the next room...

Early leaning quietly against the same wall. Listening to them. As he does, he uses the scissors to cut through the crusty bandage on his finger. Then, across the room he no Adele in bed asleep... the scissors stop.
Sequence omitted from original script.
Early exits his motel room, opens a bottle of Lucky Lager against a soda dispenser, and walks over to the motel din

Early enters the diner drinking his morning beer. Adele i not with him. He spots Brian and Carrie seated opposite o another in one of the booths. He walks up to their table drops down uninvited on the seat next to Carrie.
Morning...
Early lifts his beer bottle in salute.
Bri'.
Where's Adele?
She wasn't feeling so good.
The WAITRESS arrives with a menu, offers it to Early.
Breakfast?
(burps) Nah... Don't eat breakfast. Never  have.
The Waitress notices Early's bottle of beer.
Ah sir... sir.
She gets Early's attention.
(concerned) We ah... don't have a liquor license  here. So I'm afraid...
Well don't be, I got plenty more  where this one came from.

The Waitress gives him a curious look and walks away. Just then, Brian look past Early... A surprised expressio crosses Brian's face. Early turns to see... Adele approac the table. Her hair has been crudely chopped to resemble  Carrie's. It looks like shit.
(at a loss for words) You cut your hair.
Adele smiles, pleased with Carrie for noticing. She sits  down next to Brian.
Early cut it. (smiles at Early) ...Once he gets an idea in his head  there's no holding him back.
Carrie looks to Brian curiously. Adele is distracted by a small cactus on the window near the table.
Nice job Early.
Carrie notices Adele's 'new' (stolen) purse... We see the wheels turning in Carrie's head. How? Where?
Sequence omitted from original script.

Early walks toward the Lincoln. It is parked outside Bria and Carrie's room. The front door is ajar, he pushes it o He sees Carrie's reflection in the bathroom mirror, she's her underwear, pulling on her jeans. Early watches her fo moment. There's no mistaking what's on his mind... as his eyes scan her body. Carrie pulls on her T-shirt, steps ou of the bathroom and sees Early just outside the door.
...Need a hand with those bags?
No, thanks, I can manage.

Carrie turns back to the dresser and gathers up the last things. She glances into the dresser mirror looking for  Early's reflection at the door, but he's gone. Relieved, turns the corner to grab her bags and finds Early standin right there! Looking at her. He startles her.
I got 'em.
He picks up her bags and walks out of the room. Carrie wa him, then she steps to the doorway.
All set?
(startled) Fuck!
Take your time.
Early places the bags in the Lincoln's trunk. Adele sees  Early carrying Carrie's bag, Adele looks jealous.
In the foreground Carrie's door closes. TO BLACK.
Lincoln passes through frame.

Brian at wheel, Carrie next to him loading her camera. Ea in the back seat, Adele next to him pulls out some make u from her bag, we see the little cactus from the motel lob She begins to put on some lipstick. Early reaches into th frontseat and grabs the manuscript that sits between Bria and Carrie.
(starts to read) This the book your writing?
It's just a work in progress, kinda  rough.
This guy killed a mess of people.
Who?
Henry Lucas.
Henry Lee Lucas. Well he was only  convicted of killing eleven but he  claimed to have killed over three  hundred.
Wonder what all them people done  made him so mad?
Brian looks to Early in his rear-view mirror.
The front tire blows... the car lurches. Brian reacts, pu the Lincoln to the side of the road in a dusty halt.
Brian and Early unload the trunk to get to the spare tire
Brian struggles with the wheel and the jack.
Here Bri' let me do that.
Early takes over. He pulls off his shirt, jacks the car u and begins replacing the wheel with ease.
How did he get away with it for so  long anyhow?
He almost always killed strangers.  Spent years moving on from one place  to another. That made it real hard  to track him down.

Carrie scans the landscape with her camera. She sees Adel walking around a small roadside graveyard. She is reading the epitaphs on the headstones. Carrie fires off a few sh Then she sees Early, she can't help but notice Early's le body. She zooms in on his muscles and prison tattoo. Clic Early completes the task. Together he and Brian begin put everything back in the trunk. Suddenly, from behind, Adele jumps onto Early's back,  surprising him. He gives her a "horsey ride" around the  Lincoln.
She notices Early's wallet on the ground.
She's riding him, covering his eyes playfully.
She picks up the wallet.
Early's feet galloping.
She opens the wallet to find two one dollar bills inside.
As they come around the side of the car and to a stop in  front of Carrie. She holds up his wallet... watches his e
You dropped this.
Early Grayce if this ain't your lucky  day.
She hands the wallet back to him. Something between them  goes unspoken.
The Lincoln pulls in.
I guess it's your turn to pay Early.
Early nods and Brian looks over to Carrie, making sure sh heard. The four of them get out of the car.

Early starts toward the gas station store. He checks his  wallet, two dollars left. Carrie and Adele lean against t car. Carrie lights up a cigarette. She watches Early to s what his next move will be. Brian removes the gas cap and sticks the gas pump nozzle in. It pumps away.
It starts turning over... $$$$$ Click... Click... Click..
(crossing the tarmac)... with Early. His face expressionl His mind racing...
Brian walks around the Lincoln; checking the tires. Carri watches Early intently.
He walks toward the entrance.

Inside the store he sees a video surveillance camera. It  worries him. Distracts him momentarily. Suddenly from behind him... o.s. A car horn HONKS LOUDLY! Early turns to see a late model Mercedes behind him. He j gazes at the driver. Aggravated, the driver leans on the  horn and motions Early out of his way. Early stares at th man a moment longer, then steps to one side and lets the pull past him.
A FAT MAN in his late thirties exits from behind the whee of the Mercedes. Early watches him as he takes a money cl from his pocket and walks toward the entrance to the mini market.
The gas meter dial continues to go around. $$$$$ Click... Click... Click...
The girls leaning against the car. Adele watches Carrie t a drag on her cigarette.
I used to smoke before I met Early.  But he broke me of that.
Her remark gets Carrie's attention.
Broke you?
He watches the Fat Man inside the office.
The Fat Man pays THE ATTENDANT for gas and is handed the  restroom key.
Brian walks to the front of the Lincoln. He passes Carrie and Adele...
Early don't think women should smoke  or curse or drink liquor.
So you don't do any of those things.
Carrie takes a quick look to the mini-market. She's lost  sight of Early.
Better not, or Early'd whip me.
(back to Adele) He whips you?
The Fat Man turns the key and enters the bathroom. The do starts to swing shut behind him, but... TWO FINGERS catch it before it does.
Only when I deserve it.
Brian lifts the hood of the Lincoln... Reaches for the  radiator cap.

The Fat Man is standing at the urinal. He has a ureterost bag he's emptying, when... Early's hand hits the blow dryer. A whirring sound fills room. The Fat Man turns his head. Early lunges at him fro behind, yanks his head back and rips a switchblade across his throat!
A BLAST of steam from the radiator startles Brian!
The Fat Man clutches at his throat. Sees the blood on his palms. He looks up in shock. Early pounds the man's head  into the wall.
Brian checking the oil, pulls out the dip stick.
Black oil runs down the metal blade.

The Fat Man falls to his knees against the urinal. His ha grasping the lever. The urinal flushes. Water flows. The Man's blood mixes with it. The urinal overflows. The bloo tinged water spills onto the white tile floor. Early prie the dead man's fist off the lever.
Brian slams the Lincoln's hood shut.
Early struggles to turn the fat corpse over.
Brian steps up to the gas nozzle and pulls it out of the  car.
Early reaches in the dead man's pocket and removes his mo clip.
The gas meter stops turning.
Early calmly washes his hands in the beat up ceramic sink He pulls a comb from his pocket and combs his hair in the mirror.
Brian pulls a squeegee across the front windshield. Water washes the dirt away.
The bloody water spiralling down the drain hole.
Early exits the bathroom... and runs straight into Brian, about to enter.
(friendly) Hey Bri'... ah... You don't want to  go in there. It's a real mess, if  you know what I mean.
Brian glances at the bathroom door. Down below, a thin st of the Fat Man's blood begins to trickle out from under t door... just barely touching the toe of Brian's shoe.
That bad?
...Then some.
Early puts his arm around Brian and turns him back toward the car.
Adele takes a photo of them, approaching. The attendant s up to Carrie.
(to Carrie) Comes to twenty eight dollars.
Talk to him.
Carrie points to Early. As Brian and Early approach the c Early pulls out the money clip.
Call it an even thirty.
Early peels off thirty bucks from the money clip. He sees Carrie watching him, Early smiles.
I'll drive Bri'.
Hearing that, Carrie climbs into the back seat. Adele cli over the backrest into the frontseat.
Adele, get in the back.
She climbs again into the backseat.
Early is driving. Brian riding shotgun, is making some no in his manuscript. Adele is teaching a reluctant Carrie t play a card game called "SNAP."
...Hey you're good. Thought you said  you never played before?
I haven't... I'm a fast learner.
...They never caught that Black Dolya  Killer, huh?
Dahlia, no.
Now why is that?
Some people think it's because he  never killed again. He just  disappeared back into society.
You don't sound too convinced 'bout  that?

I always thought it was the work of  a serial killer. Anyone who took  that much time and care bisecting  another human being must have been  enjoying it and would have done it  again. And again. Until someone  stopped him.
That your... "theory", ain't that  what they call it?
Yeah.
You wanna hear mine?
Carrie listens in as she continues to play cards with Ade
(amused) Sure.
Ain't you goin' to record it?
Brian picks up his tape recorder.
(into tape) Early Grayce, June twenty third.
Brian hands Early the hand held tape recorder.

(into tape) Well I'll just bet he's still alive.  Old, livin' in some trailer park or  somethin' somewhere, but still alive.  Thinkin' every night 'bout what he  done. Goin' over and over it in his  mind. How smart he was for getting  away with it.

Carrie is chilled by the intensity of Early's remark. She watches him out of the corner of her eye. SMACK! Adele's  hand hits the pile of cards and she wins the game. Startl Carrie turns back to Adele.
(to Carrie) You lose!
(to Early) I suppose anything's possible.
Brian puts one leg across the other and goes back to his  notes.
Revealing... the blood encrusted toe of his shoe.
You ever play any pool Bri'?
Up ahead a HONKY TONK BAR with a large sign "POOL TABLES,
The Lincoln passes by the LARGE SIGN.
I can hold my own...
A high angle looks down on the modest cluster of rooms be The motel sign pulses erratically in foreground. Moths fl about the light.
The Lincoln is parked in front of Brian and Carrie's room The horn honks. Early is behind the wheel, engine running Brian steps out of the motel room.
Hey Minnesota Fats!
Carrie appears at the door holding her camera.
(sarcastic) Don't forget your key.
She hands Brian the key.
Why'd I open my big mouth?
Brian takes the key and walks to the car. Carrie sees Adele standing outside her door. Brian enters the Lincoln.
(to Adele) Why didn't you go with them?
The Lincoln pulls away.
I told you how Early feels 'bout a  woman drinking.
How'd you meet Early?
Carrie swings the camera around to Adele, and snaps off a shot.

(grins) I was hitchhiking' one day and he  picked me up. At first I wasn't gonna  get in on account of his car was in  such sorry shape. I said, "I ain't  never seen a white man drivin' a car  like this."

Carrie snaps another shot of Adele. Every once in a while Adele feels like she should be "posing" for the shots tha Carrie's taking of her. So, occasionally, as she carries her conversation with Carrie, she does.
(continues) An' he said right back, "You shouldn't  judge by appearances little lady...  this vehicle might just be a flying  saucer disguised as a car, for all  you know."

Well, I got in and we got to talkin',  and the next thing I know, I'd moved  in with him in this old trailer. (beat) Hey! Wouldn't it be something if we  all ended up sharing a house together  in California?
She lowers the camera from her eye and studies Adele.
You know I can fix that haircut for  you, if you want?
You can?
A nondescript "joint" on the outskirts of town. American  cars. American pickup trucks parked outside. The Lincoln  pulls into foreground and parks. Early gets out of the Li and looks around.
I wonder if there's any "doors" out  here?
Brian exits the Lincoln and looks at Early questioning.

You know... "openings" to other  dimensions. (pause) I read there are a lot of them out  West, mostly in the desert. They say  if you know what you're doing, you  can travel anywhere in the Universe  in a matter of seconds. Wouldn't  that come in handy?
Brian looks at him blankly. He can't think of a thing to in response. Early walks toward the entrance of the bar.  Brian joins him.
By the way, I'm not much of a pool  player.
Shit, it ain't hard to play pool. I  can teach you everything ya need ta  know.
Yeah?
Hell yeah! I'll even spot ya a few  points first game.
Wait a minute. You're gonna hustle  me?
Nah... how much money have you got?
They both laugh and enter the bar.
Adele is sitting in a chair in front of the dresser mirro drinking a beer. Carrie is cutting her hair. In the mirro Adele watches Carrie for a moment. She notices the cigare dangling from her lips.
How do you get your cigarette to  stay there like that.
Carrie looks in the mirror.
I'm cool.
Could I try that?

Carrie takes out a fresh cigarette and hands it to Adele. Together they stare into the mirror with their dangling  cigarettes. Adele drops her cigarette, as she reaches dow for it she notices Carrie's portfolio.
What's this?
It's a portfolio of my work.
Your pictures. Can I see 'em?
Sure.

Adele grabs the black leather binder and sets it in her l Carrie continues to cut Adele's hair. Adele opens the bin and takes a look at the first erotic image and slaps the  cover back down. She's embarrassed.
Jesus!
Carrie watches her in amusement. After a moment, Adele  reconsiders, and opens the book. She gazes at the shockin photograph.
You took this picture?
Took 'em all.
Carrie resumes cutting Adele's hair. Adele thumbs through several photographs.
That's me.
No it is not!
Hold still.
Sorry. Boy I'll tell ya, if Early  found a picture of me like that I'd  be black and blue for a week.
Adele notices Carrie's scowl in the dresser mirror. Carri stops cutting.
(suddenly serious) You shouldn't let him do that to  you...
Do what?
Adele... are you serious?
(defensive) You think Early's bad to me, don't  you?
Yeah.
Carrie starts cutting Adele's hair again.
Well... You're wrong. I ain't saying  Early ain't never hit me... but he  never hurt me.
When Carrie doesn't respond, Adele grabs Carrie's scissor hand and stops her from continuing. Carrie looks at Adele reflection in the dresser mirror.

(continues) ...When I was fourteen years old  three boys raped me in the back of a  truck, and beat me so bad I was in  bed for almost four months... (beat) ...I feel safe with Early, most the  time he treats me pretty good. And I  know he wouldn't let nothin' like  that ever happen to me again...
Carrie is speechless, Adele looks in the mirror at her ne haircut.
Hey, that ain't so bad now.

The patrons are young men and women. Eighteen to thirty. River's Edge kids today. Leather. Ludes and Beer. Wasted. Rowdy. We follow one of the waitresses through the bar... As she passes by a pool table one of the players, A LARGE YOUNG  CRACKER, makes a grab at her...
When you gonna give me so o' that!
She spins safely out of his reach.
Maybe when you grow up a little sonny.

Some guys, close enough to hear her over the noise, laugh her put down. She moves on until she reaches... Brian standing near a small high table. Early's not with  him. She sets four beers down on the table. Brian tries t talk to her over the music. He leans in close. His mouth her ear.
These aren't Lucky Lager, I ordered  Lucky Lager.
Sorry honey, 'ain't nothin Lucky  around here.
The waitress laughs. Brian smiles and glances around the  room. He notices the Large Young Cracker staring at him.
Early steps out of the bathroom and makes his way back to Brian.
He watches the waitress disappear into the crowd, then tu to find the Large Young Cracker in his face!
What did you say to her city boy!
The Young Cracker is obviously very drunk.
Nothing, I jus...
(cuts him off) What's a jism gargling cum drunk  fairy like you looking at a pretty  girl like that for anyway?
The Young Cracker doesn't notice Early return from the  bathroom. He moves in next to Brian. Early is relaxed and nonchalant as he looks over the Young Cracker. He leans c to Brian.
(matter of factly) You'd better hit him first Bri',  'cos it's comin'.
With his eyes on Brian, Early grabs a beer. Brian is scar and confused, with one ear and one eye on the Young Crack the other on Early.
This yur' boyfriend?
(dumbfounded) What?
Hit him.
Early looks at the beer.
(angry) Bri' this shit ain't Lucky Lager!
Early takes a swig off the beer, grimaces and sprays it o It hits the Young Cracker. The Cracker looks down at his  shirt in shock. Early is oblivious.
(to Early) Hey Asshole!
Brian is frozen, confused, doesn't know who to address. E continues to ignore the Young Cracker.
They don't stock it here Early.
(to Early, furious) Why you fuckin'...

The Young Cracker moves to hit Early. Early swiftly smash his beer bottle into the oncoming face. The Young Cracker doubles over clutching his face in agony. Early kicks him the face, sending the Young Cracker to the ground. Early  finishes him off with several more kicks from his heavy w boots. Two large tough guys approach Early and Brian. Brian's he racing, Early cool as a cucumber. Instead of taking on Ea they stop, reach down and drag the unconscious man away. waitress returns to their table.
Sorry about that, he's always causing  trouble.
She sets down two beers and two shots, doubles.
These are on the house.
Sequence omitted from original script.

Carrie and Adele split the last bottle of beer between th They are sitting on the floor and Adele has Carrie's foot her lap. She's painting Carrie's toenails bright red. Nei of them is feeling any pain.

My momma's a beautician. Guess that's  where I get it from. She wouldn't  hear of my moving in with Early...  on account of his just getting out  of jail and all. Ain't seen her in  nearly a year now. I wish she'd call  me, just once.
(interrupting) What's Early been in jail for?
(reluctantly) Carryin' a gun.
...Anything else?
An' resistin' arrest... At least  that's what the Police said.
Jeez... Adele!
Adele realizes she has said too much, looks at her watch.
I'd better be goin'. It's late.
Adele hastily weaves her way out the door.
Great.
Carrie stares down at her feet. Red toenails. Cottonballs between the toes.
Sequence omitted from original script.
Early and Brian exit the bar. They make their way to the  Lincoln. On the way...
Got to see a man about a mule.
Brian looks at Early, doesn't understand.
Gotta take a piss.
Early branches off behind the car.
Any reebs left in the back seat?
Early starts to take a leak.
Aaahhhhh... (relief) That's what we used to call a beer  when we was kids... Beer spelled  backwards.
Brian reaches in the back seat and grabs the last Lucky L He crosses to the other side of the car and hands Early t beer.
Last one.
Early stares at the last of the Lucky Lagers.
...Well I probably drunk more than  my share, anyway... you go on an'  have it.
No, it's all yours. It's on me...  for saving my ass back there.
Early takes the beer.
Hey, that's what buddies are for,  right...?
Early polishes off the rest of the bottle and heaves it i the woods.

(voice drops almost  to a whisper) You know those doors I was talking  about? Found two of them back in  Kentucky. Shit, I wasn't even looking  for one the first time. Me and the  boys are just swingin' our sickles  by the side of the road, and I turned  around and there it was... this door  with this bright blinding white light  all around it... course I'm thinkin'  I must be sunstroked or somethin'...  so I close my eyes figurin' I'll  count ten and it'll be gone right...  so I'm countin'... (he closes his eyes) ...1-2-3-4-5... an' I'm 'bout ta  piss myself right... -6-7-8-9... 10.  An' I open my eyes slow, spectin' it  won't be there right...
When Early opens his eyes, he sees a concerned look on Br face.
(unconvincingly) ...and it wasn't.
An awkward silence. Then Early starts laughing. Brian follows suit. They both climb back in the car. Their forced laughter trails off. Brian shifts the Lincoln back into gear and segues  awkwardly...
What were you "swinging a sickle"  for?
Early stares at Brian. For a moment Brian is unsure what  Early will say, or do? Then Early grins...
For... 'bout three years.
Brian brakes their eye contact, looks back out onto the  highway and just drives off.
Sequence omitted from original script.

The door opens revealing Brian silhouetted in the doorway Under the influence of Lucky Lager, he fumbles with the k gets inside and noisily shuts the door behind him. Carrie remains stonily silent, in the dark.
Gotta see a man about a mule... What's  wrong?
A few seconds pass.
The same thing that's been "wrong"  the whole trip. Your good buddy Early.
Carrie, in bed, switches on the side table light. Reveals Brian leaning on the wall trying to get his shoes off wit falling over.
Who said he's my good buddy?
You sure been acting like you were... (redneck accent) ...Out whoopin' it up, a drankin'  and ever' thang.
Brian points to the empty beer bottles on the table.
Hey come on, you two were drinking  too... so what's the big deal.
Brian throws his shoes somewhere and heads toward the  bathroom.
Yeah, and you should've seen how  terrified she was that he'd find  out. He beats her.
How do you know that?
She told me... (adding) ...but only when she "deserves" it.  Did you know he was in jail?
Brian turns on the light. Takes a piss. A long one.
Yeah, for stealing a car. Aaahhhh.
Suddenly, from right behind him:
Bullshit!
Startled, Brian turns to see Carrie.
...He told her it was for carrying a  gun, but the truth could be murder  for all we know.
No response from Brian. Carrie walks away.
Carrie steps over to the bed, pulls the sheets back. Bria leans out the bathroom door:
Stop being so fucking melodramatic!  If it was murder he'd still be locked  up or on parole, in which case he  wouldn't be allowed to leave the  state.
Maybe he wasn't allowed to leave!  Geezus Brian!
Brian smacks himself on the forehead (a sarcastic "how st of me!") He pulls his shirt off over his head, and admits
(sarcastically) Of course! The accent, the clothes,  and those table manners!... He's got  to be a mass murderer! (pause) What else could he be?
He switches off the bathroom light, steps out of the door and begins to pull his jeans off. Carrie climbs into bed.
You know, it wouldn't even surprise  me if he turned out to be... a  Republican!
Brian tosses his jeans and moves toward the bed. Carrie  switches off the the only light in the room. In the dark, hear a thud as Brian trips over a chair.
Goddamnit!... my fucking toe!
Carrie leaves the motel room, ice bucket in hand.
(to Brian inside room) Try not to lose consciousness 'til I  get back.
At the far end of a narrow hallway, Carrie finds an ice  machine rumbling away noisily. The only illumination, a s fluorescent light bulb, hangs suspended above it.

With her arm buried inside the ice machine, Carrie scaven for what little ice there is... when, out of the corner o her eye, she notices... SOMEONE standing at the other end of the corridor. The  silhouette of a man. Carrie stops. Her eyes scan the claustrophobic hallway fo another way out. There is none. She tries to ignore the situation. Grabs another handful ice cubes. The man approaches. Carrie stops again. Her mi races. The man's face slowly becomes visible as he nears fluorescent light. It's Early.
Ain't you done enough drinking for  tonight?
...Brian hurt his foot.
Early reaches past her into the ice machine and grabs a  solitary cube. He puts it in his mouth, sucks on it. His  torso is drenched in sweat. He catches Carrie staring at  him.
Sometimes... Don't know why it is...  I get so hot I can't stand it. I  just start sweating like a dog. You  ever get like that?
(tenuous) No.
Early spits the ice cube back into his hand. He presses i against the back of his neck.
I can feel it start to run down my  neck... (he turns his back to  show her) ...and down my back... right into my  pants.
Carrie follows a bead of ice water as it slides down betw his shoulder blades and along his back.
...and everything starts stickin'  together... keeps running down the  back of my legs like two rivers racin'  for my boots, see who gets there  first.
He snaps a look back to Carrie and finds her looking at h ass. She diverts her glance.
You never get that hot, huh?
Carrie shakes her head no. Early looks in his hand to see that his ice cube has melted.
I gotta get back before this ice  melts.
Carrie tries to slip past him. He reaches back into the  machine, momentarily blocking her exit. He grabs another cube. His face only inches from hers.
...never?
No, never. Excuse me.
He pops the ice cube in his mouth and lets her pass.
You like Skynard?
No response, Early chews up the ice cube.
Sequence omitted from original script.
The car crawls out of the parking lot.

Carrie is driving. Brian is contending with a major hango There is still a silent tension between Brian and Carrie  from the argument the night before. Early is in the back  with Adele. Brian moves his head and moans.
My daddy always took sauerkraut juice  and tobasco sauce for a hangover,  mixed in one egg not two, and some  tomato juice...
From the front seat, Brian's hand springs up in a despera plea for an end to Adele's colorful description.
I'm okay, thanks.
Brian rolls down his window for some fresh air, as the ca pulls away.

head_text.subj: THE CAR IS HEADING DOWN A COUNTRY ROAD.

text: Carrie glances over at Brian, who is now asleep next to h She looks up into her rear-view mirror...

Early is asleep, leaning against the door. Adele is rumma through a large canvas bag on the seat next to her.  Suddenly... The wail of an approaching ambulance gets Car attention. It roars by. Carrie glances in the mirror agai The next instant, unexpectedly...
She furiously pulls the car off the road to an abrupt hal
Brian's heads bangs against the side window.
What! What!
Carrie nods toward the back seat. Brian turns and sees Ad looking back at them questioningly. Beside her, Early rus
What is it?
Look again!
Brian notices that Adele's rummaging has revealed an auto pistol in the open canvas bag. Brian stares at it. Early' eyes open.
