A deserted plain. It's very quiet here. Until the silence broken by the sound of gunshots. Reveal Early teaching Br how to shoot. A row of tin cans are set up on a rusty old car. It's obvious that Brian's enthralled with the idea o shooting the gun. Even if he isn't hitting anything.
Only thing my old man ever gave me  is that goddamn .45.
Brian fires off another shot, misses again.
Bri', you're jerkin' it when you  pull the trigger, hold it real steady.
Nearby stands an unhappy Carrie. Adele pulls her yoyo out her pocket.
Boys'll be boys.
Carrie doesn't respond. Adele offers the yoyo to Carrie.
You know any tricks?
Carrie shakes her head no. Adele withdraws her offer.
You wanna learn some?
Again Carrie declines. Her steely gaze returns to Brian.
Early helps Brian to hold the gun.
Steady... Breath in... now let half  of it out, and... fire.

BANG!! The can flies off the tree stump. Brian turns to C to see her reaction... but she's already on her way back the car, and she's furious. Concerned, Brian starts to fo after her... But Early grabs his attention.
Bri, I want you to keep this gun...  consider it a present. Never know,  California could turn out to be a  dangerous place.
Brian gazes at the gun resting in the palm of his hand.
The Lincoln rolling along.

Brian is driving. Carrie keeps to herself. In her side mi she catches a glimpse of Early curled up in Adele's lap. watches a moment longer... and realizes that they are mak out. Beginning to kiss and touch one another.
The Lincoln turns off the main highway onto a dirt road. the distance, we see a large rundown building.

The Lincoln pulls up to the ramshackle structure. Brian  glances to the back seat to make a remark to Early and Ad and sees that they are amorously engaged. Brian and Carrie start to gather their stuff. Carrie open the glove compartment, inside are boxes of film... and th .45 automatic. She takes a few packs of film, and closes glove compartment.
Tell ya Bri., I'm still a little  sleepy,... think Adele and me are  gonna take us a fiesta.
(pissed off) Siesta.

Carrie reaches over and takes the keys from the ignition, locks the glove compartment and pockets the key. Both she and Brian exit the car. As they start to walk toward the  structure Brian hears a sound, he turns back to see. Adel leaning forward into the frontseat as the lincoln's big w top starts to come up.

Even in daylight, the interior of the dilapidated old bui is equal parts unnerving, austere, and menacing. The last rays of sunlight stream through what remains of the windo The light falls on a long ominous row of wicked looking m hooks hanging from the ceiling. Carrie is getting her camera equipment ready. She's quiet and uncommunicative.
CLOSE, on a small audio cassette player as it comes to re on a giant butcher block table in the center of the room. Brian pops a cassette in the player.
What's that?
A copy of a tape they found. He  recorded everything.

Camera in hand, Carrie begins to move about, despite the  fact that this place repels her. Brian presses a button on the audio cassette player. The  small tinny speaker plays a bad recording of something we slowly come to realize is the unmistakable sounds of a wo being tortured and pleading for her life.
Carrie fires off a series of shots from different angles. Brian scans the place trying to imagine what happened. Sc from the audio tape bounce off the walls.
(speaks into his small  hand held tape  recorder) His mother had him working in here  before he was eight years old...  killing animals with a sledgehammer  that was bigger than he was.
Brian and Carrie walk through the remains of a doorway in another room.
When she was pissed at him, she'd  beat the shit out of him and lock  him in here overnight...
The pleas for help and screams on the tape subside to a s whimpering.
(continuing) ...Eventually the boy wakes up one  morning, picks up that sledgehammer  and starts hurting back.
Carrie takes a few more shots of the ominous interior. Th she stops, turns and walks out of the room. She's had eno Brian follows after her.
There's more...
I'm finished.
Carrie stops to pick up the rest of her gear.
Look... I know you're pissed off  about the gun, and I don't blame  you...
Carrie wheels around to face him.
Brian, I'm not pissed off. God damm  it, turn that thing off.
She switches off the cassette player.
I'm scared. A week ago you would  never have even thought to pick up  that gun. This afternoon you're out  there wielding it around like Clyde  fucking Barrow, for Christ's sake!  What's with you?
Okay, it was a cheap thrill, it was  stupid, I admit it, alright? (pause) But let's not blow this. Not now...  Let's just get the photos.
I can't believe I agreed to do this.
Oh come on, don't give me that shit...  you wanted to take these photos as  much as I wanted you too.
Wrong! I was willing to do whatever  it took to get you up off your ass  and on the way to California...  There's a big difference.
Carrie storms out of the place. She exits the tunnel, and makes her way toward...

As she approaches it, through the rear windshield she see Early and Adele fucking wildly! Carrie wants to turn away, but she can't stop watching th Fascinated, she raises the camera to her eye and zooms in them.

Early is sitting against the back seat. Adele is straddli him. Carrie's finger finds the shutter button. Early's arms move up under Adele's dress... Her hands pre up against the roof. She's trembling... Wavering... Carri finger presses down on the button, CLICK!! Then in one swift movement Early sweeps Adele onto the ba seat. Close on Early's face. He's sweating... Lips moving Talking dirty to Adele. Keeping her finger on the button, Carrie rapid fires thro a whole roll of film. She's oblivious to the whine of the motor drive once all the film is shot out. Then unexpectedly!! Early looks directly into the camera, Carrie. And smiles... And continues to fuck Adele. A chill rushes through Carrie, she almost drops the camer She runs back toward the tunnel... and right into Brian's arms. He startles her. She pulls away from him.
Brian I want him out of our car!
Why, what did he do?
Brian get him out of the car. Next  gas station either he leaves or I  do!
The Lincoln passes through frame. In the background, the  surreal image of an industrial complex bathed in an eerie artificial light.

location: LINCOLN PULLS INTO A GAS STATION

text: An electrical storm is in full swing.
The Lincoln barely comes to a stop at the pumps before Ca storms out of the car and heads toward the gas station  interior. She leaves Brian to break the news to Adele and Early.

The only person inside is a YOUNG MALE ATTENDANT. He's  watching TV behind the counter as Carrie enters. On the T we see a NEWSMAN. We only catch fragments of what he is s because the storm outside is affecting the TV reception.
Twenty dollars in the tank and a  carton of cigarettes.
In fact, each time the lightning flashes occur all of the electrical power at the station is affected. The fluoresc lights outside and inside begin to flicker and falter  sporadically.
...the ex-mental patient with a  history of arrests is still at  large...

Static. Carrie looks at the TV, watches for a moment. It doesn't  hold her attention. She looks away and notices Adele leav the car. Adele walks toward a Coke machine at the other e of the gas station.
Here's your cigarettes...
Carrie turns back toward him.
...And change. Better be careful,  looks like a bad one coming. Where  you headin'?
California.
Hear it never rains there. Must be  nice.
He buttons up his rain coat and goes out into the night t gas up the Lincoln. Carrie pulls a pack of cigarettes fro the carton, nervously lights one up. She looks out the wi toward the Lincoln.
Through flashes of lightning and thunder she sees Brian i the car talking to Early. Early listening quietly. Brian  looking adamant yet apologetic. The attendant fills the  Lincoln's tank.
Simultaneously, as Carrie watches this... Behind her on t TV screen... A wave of interference scrambles the picture
...we would like to repeat...
Static.
...there is a nationwide manhunt  for...
Static.
The static clears and the Newscaster appears.
...is believed responsible for the  murders of his landlord John  Diebold...
Static.
Brian's still talking -- using his hands to explain. Earl is watching him with a resigned expression.
A video tape image of a familiar gas station recorded by surveillance camera.
...of the fatal stabbing and robbery  of Mr. Joseph Davies Robbins...

She stares at the TV with growing horror as she notices a familiar black Lincoln in the background. In mid-ground, male figure approaches the video camera unknowingly. Slow Early's image becomes visible.
If you see this man...
Carrie panics, turns toward the door and runs smack into arms of a dripping wet Early Grayce! Early stares at her drops his bag to the ground.
I ain't ridin' in no bus... bitch.
Then... Early notices himself on the TV.
...call your local police or FBI...
Static. Early grabs Carrie around the neck and yanks her into the back office. He pushes her down onto a chair.
You just sit there and keep your  mouth shut.
He searches behind the cash register and finds a sawed-of shotgun. He shuts the TV off.
I knew that boy'd have a hogleg here  somewhere.
The Attendant rushes back in from the pouring rain. Early points the sawed-off shotgun at him.
Get over here.
Early forces him into the office.
Sit your ass down in that corner.

Adele enters the adjacent room. She checks out the variou vending machines in search of candy. Early taps on the wi and motions her into the office. She sees Carrie in the c scared to death, and Early aiming the gun at the Attendan
Early, what're you doin'?
Go back to the car and keep Brian  there. I don't want him in here... (beat) Do it Adele... Now!
Adele looks back at Carrie, then hurries out. Early empti the cash register.
What's your name, boy?
(very scared) Walter Livesy.
Think. I might just have to kill you  Walter. How do you feel about that?
Not so good. You sure you have to?
I don't know. Wish I did.
Early, just think...
Shut your mouth.

Adele opens the door on the driver's side looking scared. Brian is in the passenger seat. He's looking in the glove compartment for a map. The .45 automatic Early gave Brian clearly visible. Adele stares at it.
Adele, what are you doing back here?
Adele gets in and starts looking under the seats.
...Lost my purse... Could you help  me look for it? It's probably under  the seat.
The Attendant is reaching up, handing Early the money fro his pockets. Carrie is seated in front of him.
Where you from Walter?
(nervous shake) Vernon, Florida.
Never heard of it, any huntin'?
Turkey mostly.
Turkey's are real smart. Smarter  than most people think...
Early rips the phone out of the wall.
Tell you what Walter, you lie down  there now... You make sure you stay  put for a while after we leave...  Okay?
The attendant nods yes.
...Mind if I hold that Bible?
What do you need a Bible for?
The attendant has no response.
You think I'm goin' to kill you.  Well that'd make me a liar then  wouldn't it?
No sir.
Early takes the Bible off the desk and hands it down to t Attendant.
Here you go.

The frightened young man lies face down on his stomach  clutching the Bible and starts to pray. On the counter next to him Early notices a large stuffed  "happy face" display. "Free with every 20 gallon purchase He grabs one, stares at its face curiously.
(mumbles to himself) I wonder if Adele would like one of  these? (beat) Nah...

Suddenly... He puts the barrel of the gun between the "ha face" eyes... Points it at the back of the attendant's he Carrie begins to scream. Early pulls the trigger. The blast explodes the "happy face" and rips into the bac of the Attendant's head, killing him.
A thunderous crackle of lightning all but masks the gunsh The rain starts pouring down.
What was that?
Adele stares blankly back.
The room fills with billowing down stuffing. As the stuff floats to the floor it sticks to their hair, skin and  clothes...
(surprised at the  feathers) What the fuck!
Brian opens the door to leave.
Early drags Carrie out of the office toward the car. Bria sees them running toward the car. They spill into the bac seat. Brian sees Carrie is upset.
Carrie, what's wrong? (to Early) Early, we went through this already,  you have to leave.
From the back seat Early wipes some more feathers from hi face, then points the Attendant's gun at Brian's head.
(spits out a feather) 'Fraid not Bri'... Drive Adele.
Adele starts the car. She pulls out of the station and in the rainstorm.
The last of the feathers fall like snow. The whole room i now white except for a red stain around the head of the d Attendant.
The car moves down the highway. Early in the back seat is still trying to brush away feathers.
Hate to be an Indian-giver but I'm  gonna have to ask for my gun back.
Brian reaches in the glove compartment. He removes the gu and hands it to Early.
(to Early) What happened back there?
Carrie sits in the corner of the back seat, covered in  feathers but not even noticing them.
He shot him in the head... oh God!
Adele turns to the back of the car to face Carrie.
(raising her voice) He did not, you liar. Take that back.
The Lincoln swerves off onto the side of the road. Adele  looks to the front again and steers it back onto the high
He's a killer, Brian... He's fucking  insane.
Everybody just shut up!
Early picks some more feathers off himself.
You two just cooperate and do what I  say, and we'll all arrive safe and  sound in California, as planned...  unless, of course, Adele don't kill  us first with her driving.
The St. Christopher statue swings from the rear-view mirr The windshield wipers sweep back and forth against the po rain.
The Lincoln pulls up at the rear of the store. Adele exit carrying a couple of bags of Chinese take-out food.
Adele enters the decrepit store. The others are inside. B and Carrie are tied up. Brian watches Early intently as h takes one of the bags from Adele. He begins opening one o the carry out containers.
What the hell is this stuff?
It's Chinese food. It was the only  place open. You said you was starving,  you'd eat anyth...
Early opens another container. Stares curiously at the  contents.
Yeah but, what is it?
I don't know, they didn't speak too  good English.
Early sets the container down.
And just what exactly are the Chinese  doing here in the middle of the  American desert anyway?... Didja get  the beer?
Adele somewhat reluctantly hands Early a bottle of beer f a second bag.
..."Chink" beer!
Early notices that Brian is watching him intently. He mis Brian's interest for hunger.
Oh hell, I'm sorry Bri. Adele, honey,  untie Brian, he's starving over there. (pause) Carrie, you want some?

Carrie doesn't respond at all. Adele unties Brian. Early pulls out his gun, puts it on the table next to him Brian sits across from Early. He watches as Early rummage impatiently through the carry out paraphernalia.
Where's the damn forks and spoons  at!
Frustrated, Early finally takes a gulp of Chinese food ri out of the container. It goes down rough.
...Is it just me, or has this whole  trip been goin' downhill ever since  we ran outta Lucky Lager?

Brian picks up a pair of chopsticks, then reconsiders, pu them back down and, like Early, gulps from the container. NEARBY, Carrie sits quietly. As she listens to the two me talk... she notices something on her arm. She lifts her a up to get a closer look.
She sees that a few of the white down feathers still clin to her. Closer... and she sees that one of the tiny feath is tinged with blood. The Gas Station Attendant's. It fre her.
(quietly) How many people have you killed Early?
Early stops... thinks for a moment.
She tries to brush the bloodied feather away... but with hands bound, she can't reach it.
Well now, how many people d'you see  me kill?
Brian shakes his head.
None.
In quiet desperation, she raises her arm to her lips... a blows the solitary blood tinged reminder away.
Early stares at Brian.
...Well then, that's how many I  killed.
(unconvincingly) If you say so.
Damn right I do.
Adele watches the tiny down feather drift to the floor.
Early picks up a different container and gulps some down. After a moment...
You never killed anyone have you  Bri'?
Brian shakes his head no.
You never even seen anybody killed,  right?
Brian stops eating and looks at Early.
What are you getting at?
Early leans closer to him.
You wanna tell me how'n the hell you  gonna write a book 'bout somethin'  you don't know nothin' 'bout?
Eye to eye, the two men stare at one another. Brian has n answer.
Ya see what I'm sayin'? (beat) Ha!
(nervously mimes the  same) ...Ha.
Early goes back to gulping down his dinner. This time he  gets a spicy one.
(a nod toward the  carry out container) ...watch out for that stuff, it bites.
Brian gazes at the cluster of Chinese carry-out food  containers. An ironic reminder of an earlier conversation He lets out a weak ironic laugh.
(recollecting to  himself) ...way too much MSG.
Early is behind the wheel, not a care in the world. Adele sits beside him playing with her camera. She turns and ai the camera at Brian and Carrie in the back seat, their ha are bound.
Smile.
Neither makes any attempt at smiling. Adele snaps their p anyway. In the front seat, she sits quietly for a moment  then leans over to Early and whispers something to him.
No way. I guarantee you he was  breathing when I walked outta there.
Adele sits back quietly. Carrie wants to speak but doesn'
Hey... Ain't we getting near the  next murder site... Bri?
Forget about it, doesn't matter.
Hell it don't... (beat) ...Hand me Brian's map there Adele.  One day I'm gonna pass some store  and see your book in the window. Me  and Adele gonna buy a copy for our  coffee table.
Carrie silently fuming in the back seat. Brian stares at rope that binds his wrists.
The Lincoln drives down the dirt access road and stops. T all get out, Early unties Brian and Carrie.
Figured your hands might be starting  to hurt.
Early looks down the hill to the old mine building.
Let's have a look. You girls coming?
Carrie's steely gaze answers Early's question.
Can I just wait here?
Early leans into the car and picks up Adele's camera.
Don't worry Bri', I'll take the  pictures. (to Adele, with a  kiss to her cheek) ...you stay here with Carrie. (to Carrie) You run off... Bri' pays the price.  Karma, remember?

Pistol in hand, Early follows Brian down the hill. Adele  begins nervously playing with her yoyo. Carrie watches as Brian and Early disappear around a bend the dirt road. Out of the corner of her eye, she hones in Adele's yoyo. Adele becomes increasingly intense about manipulating the yoyo, controlling it. Until she's lost in it. A momentary refuge.
This is called walk the dog.
A huge excruciatingly tight shot of the yoyo in slow moti Its string unraveling as it spins downward. Carrie pulls gaze away.
The desolate surrounding landscape, a bright blue sky, th scrubbrush. And no one who can help them. Carrie turns an looks over her shoulder down the hill.
The old mine building, rusted and deserted since the late '20's.
So tell me... what happened here?
Two brothers, prospectors, lived  here. Up until a few years back.
Flash! -- Early takes a photo with the Instamatic.
(coaxing) ...and?
They picked up hitchhikers... young  men... and brought them back here.
Early scans the grounds.
Where'd they do it?
Reluctantly Brian leads Early toward the old mine buildin At the opening, Early hesitates.
Bri.
Brian stops in his tracks.
Adele's yoyo skitters across the gravel road surface.
Brian turns back to Early.
This ain't going to give me  nightmares, is it?
Then in a snap!... the yoyo recoils into Adele's palm.
A distant empty ribbon of road.
Her eyes searching for anyone who could help.
This is one of my favorites... rock  the cradle.
Brian and Early are silhouetted against the dying sky. Fl Early takes another photo.
...They asked them just before they  were executed why they did it. They  said "to be famous." (beat) Why do you do it?
Flash!! Early takes a flash photo of Brian, momentarily  blinding him.
Do what Bri?
Early moves slowly toward Brian.
We both know you didn't have to kill  that gas station attendant.
Brian's eyes dart nervously to the gun dangling in Early' palm. Flash!
In slow motion Adele's hands manipulate the yoyo and stri
You wanted to. (beat) Why?
Flash! Brian flinches. Early remains silent as he closes on Brian.
It make you feel good? Powerful? (Flash!) Superior, what? Come on Early, tell  me something. (Flash!) Were you angry?
Early's boot lands toe to toe with Brian's shoe.
(tentative) Who are you angry with Early... your  mother, your father?
Eye to eye, the two men stand there.
You want to know about my daddy,  I'll tell you about my daddy, Bri...
Carrie walks over to Adele at the car. Adele doesn't miss beat with her yoyo.
Adele, listen to me... Early's sick;  he should be in a hospital.

Adele screws up the trick. She pulls the yoyo off her fin and throws it in the back seat. She leans into the front  seat and cranks the radio up to the max. Closing her eyes she begins moving to the music, and tries to ignore Carri
(shouting over the  music) The police are after him, he's a  murderer!
(uncertain) ...That's not true.
(shouting) What?
(shouting back) That's not true!
A POLICE CAR pulls into frame, unnoticed by Carrie and Ad in the background.
Let's take a look.
I'll call in the plate.
The Male Officer exits, unlocking his holster. The Female Officer picks up the police radio and calls in the licens plate number.
The radio is blaring. Adele continues to dance despite  Carrie's pleas.
(shouting) ...I wouldn't lie to you, Adele. . .  I saw him kill that man.
(defensive) Early didn't kill nobody, he wouldn't  do that. I don't know why you're  saying those things. You ain't my  friend.
With that, Adele stops her dancing and turns away from  Carrie... To see the Male Officer walking toward them.
Please don't say anything Carrie.
The Male Officer continues toward them. It looks like he' talking to them... but his voice is inaudible under the  deafening radio.
The Female Officer sticks her head out of the police car yells to her partner. He turns to listen.
We got a match, I'll call for back  up.
As the Male Officer turns back, he sees Adele reach into front seat of the Lincoln. The Male Officer draws his rev and levels it at Adele.
Click! Adele shuts the radio off, total silence. As Adele leans back out of the car, she turns, facing directly int the barrel of the Male Officer's gun.
All right ladies, I want both of you  to slowly step away from the ca...

BANG! A single gunshot rings out! The Male Officer jerks  back and falls to the ground. Adele screams! Carrie whips panicked glance around and sees... Early running toward t Brian, bewildered, follows behind.

Ahead of him, he watches Early race past the wounded Male Officer. He kicks the Officer's revolver out of reach and rushes toward the police car. Early fires his gun repeatedly as he charges the car! The Female Officer pulls her gun and starts to get out of the car, when... a shot shatters the windshield hitting h in the chest. She collapses back onto the seat.

He stops at the sight of the wounded Male Officer. Shocke he watches the man writhing in pain. His hands clutching crotch. His blood oozes into the dirt. Early approaches the police car. He sees the dead cop and hears the radio dispatcher.
Officer needs help, shots fired, six  Adam five, one eighty-seven, suspects  wanted in multiple murders. Location  unknown, last seen...

Brian is not sure what to do. He looks around... sees the Officer's handgun lying in the dirt. He takes a step towa it, when... another gunshot rings out! Brian stops. Looks the police car. He sees Early standing there, smoke belch from the dashboard... the police radio is dead. Early walks back toward Brian and the others. He steps ov to the injured Male Officer on the ground.
Tell me that don't hurt.
Early picks up the wounded cop's gun. He hands it to Bria as he trains the .45 automatic at Brian's chest.
Shoot him. You'll be doing him a  favor.
Brian looks to Early in disbelief.
No, no, I can't.
Early cocks the pistol and pushes the barrel to Brian's h Brian looks down at the wounded cop who is writhing in pa
(No,) It's the answer to all them  questions of yers.
Brian won't do it. He drops the gun to the ground.
Now you'll never know.
Early cocks his pistol.
...Don't do it. Early, look at him,  look at his face. That's not your  father.
Early stares at the wounded cop's face.
I know that. That there is a policeman  in a world of pain. And this is what  you call a mercy killin'.
Early shoots the cop again. The cop lays still. Early reaches down and takes the dead cop's handcuffs. He casually points the little camera at the dead cop. Flash!
The Lincoln hurtles down the road.
Early driving. Adele in the passenger seat looks bewilder Carrie and Brian in back, handcuffed, eyes hollow with  exhaustion and fear. Then out of the quiet...
I'm still waiting.
Adele looks across the seat to Early. Her face drained of all expression.
(disappointed) Not so much as a simple "thank you."
Adele at a loss. Finally... confused...
(empty) ...thank you.
Thank you for what? (becoming aggravated) What are you thanking me for Adele?
(hesitantly, she admits) ...I don't know.
Well Adele... it was for... (screaming at her) ...saving your fucking life back  there!
She shrinks away from him.
(gesturing with his  fingertips a fraction  apart) Darlin' you were 'bout that far from  spendin' the night at the morgue.  You understand?
He wasn't going to shoot her, you  murdering son of a bitch!
Early looks into the rear-view mirror. Brian tries to def the situation.
Carrie... stop it.
(explodes) What the fuck is wrong with you  Brian!? If you'll stop taking notes  for once and open your eyes... you'll  see that he is a homicidal fucking  killer. He is... for real!
Shut up Carrie, please... just shut  up!
The Lincoln drives along an old deserted highway passing  occasional gas stations and dilapidated motels.
Early is driving. He notices something in the distance.
Off in the distance... an oasis of greenery.
Sequence omitted from original script.
A home in a secluded valley near the desert. It has a cac garden. The garden is illuminated so it can be enjoyed at night. Reveal... the Lincoln parked by the front door.
Adele gazes out the passenger-side window. She's enthrall by the sight of all the cacti.
...I luv' cactuses 'cos they're so  strong. Don't need much care really.
Reveal Brian handcuffed to the steering wheel beside her. cranes his neck to see out the rear window...

Early steps up to the front door of the house and rings t bell. Carrie stands beside him. A light comes on inside. door slides open a crack and MRS. MUSGRAVE, an attractive older woman with silver hair, peers out with a puzzled lo
Adele rambles on.
(far away) ...You can forget about 'em forever  and then look at 'em and they're  doin' even better than before.
(watching the house) Adele... we gotta do something before  Early kills someone else.
Of Early and Carrie as they are let into the house.
Adele is still rambling on about her interest in cacti.
...There ain't nothin' can kill 'em.  They can live for two even three  hundred years.
Adele for god sake please lis...
(she glances over to  Brian) There ain't nothing we could do.  Once Early sets his mind on somethin',  well thats the end of that.
Adele drifts back to the cacti.

One of many we now reveal to be atop a fireplace mantle.  Adele leans in against the mantle and scrutinizes the cac Carrie and Brian sit on the floor, back to back, their ar bound around the leg of a piano by a pair of police handc Mrs. Musgrave is standing nearby. She's overwhelmed. Numb She pours herself a glass of bourbon.
(to herself) It's just like in that dream I had.  If only I had seen their faces.
She takes her drink and sits down on the couch nearby. Ad drops down quietly on the chair next to her.
(tries to cheer Mrs.  Musgrave up) You've got beautiful cactuses here,  I just love 'em. My momma used to  keep a garden.
Mrs. Musgrave downs most of her drink with the first try. Distressed, her head slumps down.
(from the kitchen) Hey Bri... You ever stop to think  that if you switched the two letters  in your name... (entering the room) ...it would spell Brain.
Early, his pistol wedged in his belt, appears from the ki eating a sandwich. Between bites... He walks over and rip the phone out of the wall unit. He glimpses Mrs. Musgrave
What's wrong with her?
(sorry for her) She had a dream that somethin' like  this was gonna happen.
Early notices the glass of bourbon in her trembling hands He steps over to her and takes the glass away.
I'll bet she did.
He sets the glass down next to a recent picture of Mrs.  Musgrave and an ELDERLY MAN with silver hair.
Where's your husband?
(lying) ...I'm a widow.
Early looks at her, he doesn't believe her.

Everything is quiet beneath the star studded sky. The sam elderly man pictured with Mrs. Musgrave is studying the s through a powerful telescope. MR. MUSGRAVE is an amateur  astronomer. o.s. the SOUND of a door opening. Then footst
(excited) Is that you Peaches? Come, you must  see Saturn tonight. The rings are  sensational!
Early leans into frame, staring at the display case.

Inside of it is a four foot long replica of the first ATO BOMB, "Fat Boy." Faded newspaper articles on the wall ind Mr. Musgrave had something to do with the bomb's initial  construction. An old photo on the bookshelf shows a much  younger Mr. Musgrave in a '50's kitchen. He is laughing a embracing a '50's style female mannequin.
My oh my, this is quite rare, quite  rare indeed. Come have a look...
Early's eyes drift over to a set of golf clubs that sit i the corner of the room.
The planet Saturn and its glorious rings.
Peaches?
THWACK!! The planet turns into a blur of light... then  blackness.
Brian and Carrie are still cuffed to the piano, in the  background we see Mrs. Musgrave and Adele looking out the window into the backyard.
(whispers to Carrie) You gotta talk to her. She looks up  to you, she'll listen to you.
I tried talking to her at the mine.  It didn't work.
Then try again, (it's our only  chance.)
Early is leaning on a golf club looking through the teles
Early?
He pulls his eye away as Adele arrives.
(excited) Early, Mrs. Musgrave has the most  beautiful little guest house out  back and... well, no one's stayin'  in it... it's just empty. And she  said if me and you wanted to, well  maybe we...

Suddenly, o.s., a scream pierces the moment! Early and Adele turn toward the doorway to see Mrs. Musgr screaming. The older woman's eyes staring past Adele to t floor nearby. Adele follows the terrified woman's gaze to find... Mr. Musgrave's body lying on the floor. A bloodie wound in the back of his head. All of Adele's enthusiasm  drains from her face.
(to Mrs. Musgrave) Well 'Peaches'... you're a widow  now.
Mrs. Musgrave collapses to the floor.
Brian and Carrie are still cuffed to the piano. Across fr them, Early sits in an overstuffed chair looking through  Carrie's collection of erotic photography.
(to Brian) Have you seen this one? That don't  leave much to the imagination now  does it?
He looks at another photograph. Confused, he turns it ups down, stares at it.

Mrs. Musgrave is laid out on the couch. Adele, deep in  thought, watches over the older woman. Finally Adele reac into her purse, pulls out her small potted cactus then wa across the room to a table. Its top is covered with small potted cacti. She gently places hers among them.
Mrs. Musgrave begins to regain consciousness. Her eyes op to find... Adele standing over her. Adele brings her fing to her lips -- Shhhh.
Early looks through several more photos. He stops on one a nude woman's torso. Early looks at it for a moment... t extends the photo out toward Carrie, comparing it to her.
(smiles and shakes  his head in disbelief) That's you ain't it?

Carrie doesn't answer him. Then, in the background direct behind Early... Adele and Mrs. Musgrave quietly appear. C notices them as they start to cross the hallway to the  kitchen. Early sees Carrie's eyes glance past him. He tur to see why... when...
You're right Early...
Early stops. Looks back to Carrie. Brian also turns to he curiously.
...It is me. Do you like it?
Early looks at the photo again. Adele and Mrs. Musgrave n cross safely to the kitchen. Carrie eyes meet Early's. He smiles, pulls the nude photo of her close to his face... licks it.
Adele quietly opens the back door.
Go on now... please.

Mrs. Musgrave is confused, is it a trick? She looks into  Adele's eyes... and knows it's not. The old lady turns an walks out into the dark desert. Adele stands at the open  door, watching Mrs Musgrave escape.
(in a whisper) ...Call me.
Early finishes looking through the photographs. He closes the cover of the portfolio.
Well they say there's room fur all  kinds in California... and that's  where we're gonna be this time  tomorrow. California. (beat) Adele honey?
Adele?

Early enters, and sees Adele standing at the back door. A turns to face him. Early looks past her into the night an realizes what she's done. He strides across the room pull the pistol from his waistband.
Early pushes Adele out of the way.
(shouting) Peaches! Come on back here. There  ain't nothin' for you to be afraid  of.
Aside from the occasional pools of light illuminating the cacti, it's very dark. There's no sign of Mrs. Musgrave.
He steps outside and starts firing his gun into the  blackness... bullets THUNK into the cacti.
(shouting over the  gunfire) Nobody wants to hurt you Peaches!
Early! Stop!!

Desperate, Adele grabs a large potted cactus. She rushes  toward Early. Swinging the cactus like an unwieldy bat, s pummels the side of his head. He stumbles forward,  disappearing into the darkness. Adele stands outside the  kitchen door, bewildered. Then...
Oww! Oww!! -- FUCK!!!!
Early re-emerges from the shadows. Adele's eyes widen whe she sees him. His cheek has long bloody gashes where the  cactus ripped the flesh.
(perplexed) Honey... What do you think you're  doin'?
Adele starts to cry.
Oh, n'jus what in hell you crying  'bout? I'm the one got hit.
I changed my mind, Early. I'm not  gonna climb up that Hollywood sign  with you... I decided. I think your  mean, and you hurt people.
A look comes over Early's face that we've never seen befo That he's never felt before. Hurt. He doesn't know how to deal with it. And he definitely doesn't like it.
Carrie, watch for Early.
What are you going to do?
I'm going to try and lift the end of  the piano. If I can... slide your  cuffs free.

Carrie glues her eyes to the kitchen doorway. Brian press his back up under the belly of the piano and using all hi strength manages to lift the piano an inch off the floor. Carrie slides her cuffs out from under the leg.
What about you?
I don't know.
Carrie's eyes dart back toward the kitchen. Then she noti a chair nearby.
Can you lift it again? Just lift it,  hurry.

Carrie grabs the chair. As Brian lifts the piano, she pus the chair beneath the underside of it. It holds the piano suspended an inch off the floor. Brian drops to the floor and slips the cuffs free. When... a solitary gunshot rings out from the cactus gard A moment later, Early steps quietly into the room. He's  pulling the last few cactus needles from his face. He see Brian and Carrie standing.
You two been busy in here.
What happened to Adele?
Well, let's put it this way. (beat) I need me a new woman.
A shocked silence. Brian and Carrie look to one another.  Carrie moves toward the kitchen but Early stops her! Bria rushes at him. Early sticks the .45 automatic in his face
Sorry about this Bri...
He starts to squeeze the trigger.
(desperate) Early, don't.
Early stops. He looks to Carrie.
I'll do whatever you want. You want  me to go with you, I'll go with you.  Just don't kill him.

Early deliberates the situation, then eases up off the  trigger... and smiles to Brian. Then, without warning, he hits Brian over the head with t butt of the .45 automatic. Brian falls to the floor  unconscious.

As Early finishes tieing one of the replicant bombs, Litt Boy onto the hood. He reaches down and grabs a six pack o beer on the ground and shoves it in the back seat, then s into the driver's seat next to an anxious Carrie. Carrie now wearing one of Adele's floral dresses.
Think anyone will notice?
Carrie doesn't answer, Early laughs.
Early looks out over the expanse of the desert. He sees a dirt fire road.
I'll bet there's a 'door' out there...  save us some time.
Carrie doesn't understand what he means. Nonetheless, she nods her head in agreement.
The Lincoln heads out, past the cactus garden, into the  darkness.
Adele's lifeless body on the ground near her beloved cact

head_text.subj: FADE TO BLACK WITH THE DEPARTING HEADLIGHTS

text: Brian is handcuffed on the floor. His eyes open slowly as begins to regain consciousness. He senses someone behind  him. He pivots around to see Mrs. Musgrave kneeling down help him.
In the distance, a cloud of dust reveals the Lincoln,  traveling at high speed along the dirt fire road.
Early still behind the wheel. Carrie sits up against the  passenger side door. She is tense and guarded. Out the wi nothing but empty desert.
Pass me a beer hon'.
Carrie quietly responds. She kneels on the front seat and reaches into the back. She grabs a bottle by its neck, an pulls it from the six pack of beer. Bottle in hand, she  hesitates a moment...
Early watches Carrie.
You wanna hit me with that, huh?
Carrie reconsiders and sits back in the far corner of the front seat.
(not looking at him) No.
She hands the bottle to him. Early reaches out for the be but instead of taking it, he clasps his hand over hers. He looks at her and begins to squeeze...
Stop lyin'... I can see right through  you.
Early squeezes even harder -- Carrie begins to wince with pain. She waits for the glass bottle to shatter in her ha
Who d'ya think you're foolin'? (beat) I know you better than you think...
(confused) ...You're hurting me...
Early hits the brakes. The car screeches to a halt in a c of dust. Early squeezes on her hand even harder and begin to drag her toward him.
I seen the way you been lookin' at  me since we met... Snappin' my photo  when you thought I wasn't lookin'.  Wanting me...
Carrie turns her head away. Early pulls her closer.
I saw you when I killed that boy...
He grabs her hair with his other hand... Pulls her head a forcing her to look at him. Early has Carrie right up aga him, looking right into her eyes.
(whispers) You were plenty hot.
(explodes) You sick twisted fuck! You don't  know shit about me.
She struggles trying to free herself. Early, his face onl inches from hers, smiles...
Sick... some people might say takin'  photos of me and Adele humpin' in  the back of the car is sick.
Carrie struggles even harder, but Early tightens his hold
...You know what I mean?
...I know I'd love to smash this  bottle right in your fucking face.
Suddenly... Early releases Carrie, taking the beer from h Carrie retreats back into the corner of the passenger sid
That's better... Honesty... I like  that in a woman.
He gives her a grin, then opens the bottle.
But I'll tell ya... when we get to  California, we're gonna have to do  something 'bout that gutter mouth of  yours.
Early takes a gulp of beer.
Early throws the bottle of beer out the window (it ain't  Lucky Lager), slams the Lincoln into "drive" and accelera along the dirt road.
He's pulled out all the lines. The  nearest phone is twenty miles east  of here.
Brian notices an old pickup truck parked outside.
An anxious Brian hustles into the cab of the pickup truck Some tools are in the back. Brian still wears the handcuf around his wrists. Mrs. Musgrave stands near the front do
Which way did they go?
(pointing) He took the fire road.
Take your car and get to that phone.  Call the police.
Brian starts the pickup and drives off.

The wind has picked up. An old wooden gate blocks the fir road. On either side, barbed wire as far as the eye can s The Lincoln roars into frame and powers through the barri The gate smashes into splintered pieces of wood.

Carrie leans against the passenger door. Early's eyes sca the open desert -- looking for the elusive 'doors.' Carri reaches for her pack of cigarettes. Early, without a word reaches out and takes the pack from her. He crumples it u and throws it out the window.
Carrie's eyes go to the instrument panel. The temperature gauge is in the red.

The pickup truck arrives at a crossroads and skids to a h Brian tries to guess which direction to take. Then he spo Early's discarded beer bottle up ahead. The truck acceler straight ahead, tires spinning.

location: LATER, THE SUN IS ON THE HORIZON

text: The winds continue to escalate, blowing harder and harder The Lincoln approaches on the fire road. A trail of steam streaming out from under the hood, blinding Early's view. Finally, Early slams on the brakes and skids 180 degrees a halt... Steam pours out of the Lincoln's grill. The Lin has had it. Early is indifferent and looks around. About a hundred ya away, barely visible through the growing sand storm, an o 1950's style building.
Early opens the back door. He grabs a box of supplies (so rope, a kerosene lamp etc.)
Come on.
Carrie slowly begins to respond. She slides across the fr seat.
Carrie's hand crosses frame and pulls out a knob on the d
The sun is starting to set behind a distant mountain rang In the far distance... The pickup truck, revealed by its  trail of dust, crosses the vast landscape.
Early and Carrie struggle through the growing sand storm. Carrie throws a last curious glance back to the Lincoln a they reach the front door.
The front door is kicked open. Early enters the room with Carrie in tow.
He looks around the room... A smile forms on his face.
Howdy, my name's Early Grayce and  this is my girl Carrie. I hope you  don't mind us bargin' in like this  but a... we was on our way to  California when our car broke down,  and...

A living room fully decorated in '50's furniture. Sand co everything... Including... A FAMILY OF FOUR MANNEQUINS placed around the room: The f sits in front of the TV... The mother (the same mannequin in Mr. Musgrave's old picture) is toppled over a kitchen  counter... The little girl is seated at a table... The li boy is playing with his toy plane on the floor.
Well... it's gettin' pretty rough  out there, so if it's all the same  to you, we'll be staying the night.
Early slams the front door shut.
The building is a single story '50's home of extremely ch construction. It's in bad condition.
The last rays of the setting sun reveal the pickup truck  heading toward the smashed remains of the wooden gate. Th pickup truck hurtles through the opening left by the Linc
On a collapsed old wooden sign. It lies on the ground a f feet away from the gate posts.

Wind and sand blow freely through the remains of the wind A solitary kerosene lamp dimly illuminates the living roo area. Its flickering light finds... Early, stripped to th waist, crouched over the broken TV set. He fidgets with t knobs. Then the mangled rabbit ears antenna. Carrie sits some blankets in the corner next to the couch. She's scar to death. Her eyes scan the battered room. Debris everywh Amidst all of it, Carrie's erotic photographs have been p about the room.

Still unable to get the TV to work, he smacks it a good o on the side. With the smack!... Carrie whips her look back toward Earl To find he's lost interest in the TV. He turns toward Car Stares at her for a moment. Then with a hint of a smile, begins to move toward her. The time has arrived. He reaches down, grabs her by the shirt and pulls her to feet. Carrie doesn't resist. He's rough with her as he ki her on the lips. Carrie pulls her mouth away from his. Sh seems confused, unsure of her feelings. Early watches her until her eyes come back to his. Then she steps forward  crowding her body against his, as she slips one hand arou his neck and kisses him deep and hard... Suddenly Early breaks the kiss and backhands Carrie hard  across the face. She lands on the floor several feet away the palm of her right hand is bleeding. Early looks down to his waist to find a large piece of gl protruding from his side. He pulls the glass shard out, blood drips down his side a onto his jeans. Carrie gets up and races into the back bedroom, frantical looking for a way out, there is none. On the bed the two  adult mannequins now lie naked. They have been placed,  intertwined in a grotesque sexual position. Carrie turns and rushes back toward the door. Early inter her and throws a punch to her stomach, which doubles her  over. Then Early sends a second punch to her face, she  stumbles backward, landing onto the bed amongst the  mannequins. Early begins undoing his belt.
(friendly) You'll like it...
A violent gust of wind sends several of the erotic photos swirling through the air. One of the photos whips across  Early's chest. The wind holds it there momentarily.
Not a lot, but you'll like it.
Early peels Carrie's photo off him, the blood from his wo covers the back of it. He slaps it against the nearest wa It sticks. He walks toward her.

The high winds have turned into a full fledged sandstorm. Brian is still driving dangerously fast. The dim lights o the old pickup illuminate only a short stretch of dirt ro ahead and the swirling sand. He passes a road sign: 'DEVASTATION DRIVE' Then... As the pickup truck comes around a corner Suddenl directly in front of him -- Headlights!! Brian reacts... too late!! The pickup truck ploughs into the vehicle, and tumbles en over end through the open desert, before finally coming t an abrupt halt.
With each thrust of Early's body, Carrie's badly bruised  face contorts with pain and hatred

Sand blows in through the smashed windshield of the wreck pickup truck. Brian is upside down with his eyes shut. A  trickle of blood runs down his face. Camera booms up a di slope to reveal the Lincoln, beyond it on the hill above  sits the desert house. The glow of the kerosene lamp is  visible through the windows.
The storm is over... No sand blowing. No wind. No nothing
The dawn light reveals the devastated '50's house to be o of a cluster, set at the end of a 'Doom Town' cul-de-sac.

In the darkened bedroom, Early's solitary figure rustles  atop the bed. Slowly, he awakens. His eyes open. Across t bed, a pair of handcuffs is locked around the bedpost. In the other cuff is Carrie's motionless hand. Then, out of the corner of his eye, Early sees something one of the nearby rooms. Curious, he stands, shoves the . automatic in his waistband and walks toward the hallway. As he passes through the living room and enters the hallw his face contorts with a strange sense of wonderment.
A blinding light is shafting through cracks and broken ga around the front door frame... It looks like a magical "d shrouded in a wall of light!
In disbelief he pulls his gaze away from the "door"... an sees through a window at the opposite end of the house... the morning sun rising. With that he turns his attention  back to the front door!
I knew there was doors out here!
He walks toward the doorway of light. He grins as he open the "door" and steps through it. The sunlight momentarily blinding him.
A black shadow hurtles toward him out of the brightness.. Eventually it blocks out all the light until... WHAAMM!!!

A blow knocks Early back through the doorway. He slams to the ground, on his back. The gun falls from his jeans and slides across the floor. A look of joyful amazement over blood covered remains of his face, he tries to get up, bu can't.

Brian, silhouetted, steps into the doorway. He holds a sh raised, ready to deliver a second, fatal blow... but when sees Early incapacitated on the floor, he lowers the shov to his side. His handcuffed hands reach down and picks up Early's gun. He trains it on Early, then walks around him enter the house. Brian's eyes slowly adjust to the interi

From on his back, Early looks out the open "door." He see two large shards of glass standing vertical in the sand,  reflecting the sun's rays back toward the house. He reali that the glass, placed there by Brian, is what created th effect of the "door." He starts to laugh.
(laughing) That was damn tricky of you Bri.
Brian searches for Carrie.
Carrie... Carrie... it's over.

He moves into the back bedroom and finds Carrie. She is  crouched on the floor, handcuffed to the bedframe. He mov to help her. As he gets closer, he sees her badly bruised face and realizes what's taken place throughout the night Brian stops. The sympathetic expression on his face chang With hatred in his eyes, he pivots around, strides out of the bedroom and moves toward the front of the house to Ea in the front room Gun in hand, Brian rushes back into the room. He wields the pistol toward the ground where Early  lay... but Early's not there. Brian's eyes dart around the room... then suddenly, from  behind him, Early grabs him! He wrenches Brian's head back and whips his belt buckle k toward his throat! Brian manages to lift his hands to his neck an instant be the knife tears through his flesh. The knife slices a vic wound across the back of Brian's right hand. He drops the gun to the floor. Brian elbows Early in the ribs and pull away from him. He reaches to the ground for the gun, but  Early kicks him in the stomach and sends him crumbling to his knees.
Go ahead Bri, ask me something. (beat) You wanna know how I'm feeling'?  Well I'd say I'm feelin' pretty damn  good.
On all fours, Brian reaches out for the gun, but Early ki it across the room.
How 'bout you? You feelin' good?
Another kick to Brian's chest. The wind rushes out of him
...'Cause you sure don't look so  good. (beat) Or maybe you're feelin'... powerful.  That it, you feeling powerful?  Superior? I know I am.
Early unloads a ferocious kick to the side of Brian's fac His head snaps back, his handcuffed arms buckle and he fa flat to the ground.
What? Am I angry with my daddy? Now  why would I be angry with my daddy...  you're the one hit me with the shovel.  And you're the one's gonna wish you  hadn't.

With one last effort, Brian manages to pull himself back to his knees. He focuses on the gun ahead of him and trie to crawl toward it. But Early's foot shoves Brian. He fli over onto his back, landing in front of the bedroom doorw Early moves toward him, knife in hand. As Early moves toward Brian, unexpectedly from inside the doorway, the torso of the female child mannequin whips pa Her hardened molten face slams into Early's bloodied face Early stumbles backward. Brian crawls for the gun and grabs it. From his knees he  turns, steadies the weapon, takes a quick breath... and f Hitting Early square in the chest! Early falls to the ground on his back. Brian lifts himsel to his feet. He sees that Carrie has dragged the bedframe to the doorw and in her free hand she holds the child mannequin by the leg. Gun in hand, Brian steps over to Early. Early's body is s Blood oozes from the hole in his chest. On a silver chain around his neck is the key to Brian and Carrie's handcuff Brian reaches down and grabs the keys... when suddenly Ea arm springs up from his side. His hand grabs Brian's shir collar. Brian is startled by the move, then realizes that Early's hold is weak. His fingers tremble. Finally his ar drops back down to his side.
Hey Bri... I think I need a doctor.  What d'ya say?
The two men stare at one another for a moment... then Bri with one hand still on the handcuff keys, shoves the .45  automatic firmly under Early's chin.
...Sorry 'bout this Early.
